The team

Join BIPO Global Innovation Hub on an adventure to make BIPO the best HR solutions provider in the world. We make life easier for our customers and employees, always finding the next 80/20 in business, in data and in people. We conceive, communicate, and build unique capabilities for BIPO that will need to live up to proof-points. This is not an easy job but one that will put to test our strengths, vulnerabilities, and prioritisation, very much like a team sport. Moloco is a machine learning company that enables businesses to unleash the power of their own data for fast, sustainable growth and performance through the advertising ecosystem. Our technology is best-in-class as we received the SMARTIES X silver award for Machine Learning and AI and were named the Cross-Industry Winner for Google Cloud Customer Awards. Moloco is in hyper-growth mode, ranked #91 among Deloitte's 2021 Fast 500, and recently certified by 91% of the company via Great Places to Work. There isn't a better time to join this innovative team in our Silicon Valley HQ or our offices in San Francisco, Seattle, London, Seoul, Singapore, China, and Tokyo.

While tackling challenging real-world problems, you will make a positive impact on hundreds of millions of mobile users and grow with top-notch colleagues.

 Implement state-of-the-art algorithms that process sensor data (e.g. Lidar, cameras) for terrain mapping, segmentation, object detection and object tracking. Assist Senior Engineers with design and development of algorithm prototypes and conducting experiments and demonstrations.

 Currently studying for a degree in Computer/Electrical/Electronic/Mechanical/Mechatronic Engineering, Computer Science or any Robotics related discipline. A good understanding of Data Structures and Algorithms. Good software development skills (preferably in C++ or Python) and good understanding of Object Oriented Design and Development. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Self-motivated and ability to take initiative.

job_desc:
Kick off your career with us 🚀

Surer is an InsurTech startup that will revolutionise the way the General Insurance industry manages their entire workflow, from an agent advising their clients (the end policyholder) to how the Insurer distributes their products.

And as a Frontend Engineering Intern, you get to be a part of the revolution! We are building delightful experiences for insurance intermediaries and some of the biggest insurers out there, and this internship at Surer only means you design, build, and ship for them! At Surer, you can take on big responsibilities to solve some of today's greatest problems in the Insurance industry. If you want to understand how a startup functions and have the ambition to work on something that is totally novel; to make a difference to a $1 Trillion industry, Surer is the place for you!

Responsibilities

We are looking for a talented and self-driven Frontend Web Engineer who learns fast and has the nous to think out-of-the-box - to make a big difference for the Insurance industry and empower the parties within this ecosystem.

Your day to day task will be focused on working directly with the founding team and be on the leading front to develop new features, suggest better processes, re-engineering and testing of functionalities.

In summary, you will: Work to design an eye-catching and responsive user interface, make the user experience on our platform simple and seamless and implement the background functionality in the most cost-effective and memory-friendly way. Ship new and impactful features by building beautiful and intuitive interfaces for our users. Help the team design user flows and iterate the product based on feedback from our customer-facing teams. Fine-tune frontend code for better performance and implementing best practices Work with our UI/UX designer and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs Ensure that all user input is validated before submitting to backend Work with backend developers for continuous development and deployment

Experience and Skill Sets

Must have: Experience with React.js Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript Experience with backend development is a plus Experienced in web technologies such as HTML, CSS and Javascript Familiar with ReactJs and/or VUE Javascript Frontend Frameworks Understands the concept of web development such as HTTP, HTTPS protocols, backend code integration with frontend code via RESTful APIs

Nice to Have: Knowledge of PHP Git workflows CI/CD practices Currently studying for a Diploma / Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science or equivalent Familiar with frameworks such as jQuery, Bootstrap and AngularJS UI/UX design exposure and experience in making web applications work intuitively Able to work independently as well as in a team Able to multitask in a demanding, fast paced environment and work with minimal supervision to meet deadlines

What you can get out of us

Exposure to a fast-paced, yet fun, startup culture Work directly with the founding team and be part of the decision-making team Getting to know the whole development cycle and processes Opportunity to develop game-changing products Flexible working hours Gain knowledge and experience in the InsurTech and FinTech industry Flat team structure with no office politics, you will be treated like a co-founder! Work in a highly stimulating environment at our investor’s office, along with many other startups and like-minded folks Besides hands-on learning opportunities, you will also be engaged on every aspect of running the business We are a young startup and so have many interns in the team - get to meet like-minded people at the same stage of your career!

About Surer

Surer is a cloud-based, web platform with a market-first technology in the region, that helps all parties in the General Insurance industry automate processes and drive network collaborations, enabling them to provide better service and support to their clients. Launched in August 2020 in Singapore, Surer was founded by a group of professionals with years of experience in the Insurance industry who are passionate about solving inefficiencies within the General Insurance industry as it was a problem they had faced as well. Surer is certified by the Singapore FinTech Association as an InsurTech service provider and is one of the portfolio companies funded by Antler, a global early-stage venture capital firm that invests in the defining technology companies of tomorrow. Visit https://surer.sg/ for more information or read about us in the media at https://surer.sg/category/in-the-news/.

About The Founders

Founded by Gordon, Derren and Renfred, we have held positions to grow the business in highly successful startups like PropertyGuru and Carousell, successfully founded and exit-ed from a VendTech startup, ShakeSalad, while also having careers in major insurance companies like AIG, MSIG and QBE. One of us is even an Asian Games Gold Medalist!

Getting onboard Razer will place you on a global mission to revolutionize the way the world games. Razer is a place to do great work, offering you the opportunity to make an impact globally while working across a global team located across 5 continents. Razer is also a great place to work, providing you the unique, gamer-centric #LifeAtRazer experience that will put you in an accelerated growth, both personally and professionally.

Are you game?

Company Description

STACS (Hashstacs Pte Ltd) is a Singapore FinTech company providing Transformative Technology for the Financial Industry, with its live blockchain platform that unlocks value in Asset/Wealth Management and Digital Securities, enabling effective Sustainable Finance. Its clients and partners include global banks, stock exchanges, and asset managers. STACS is an Award Winner of the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) Global FinTech Innovation Challenge Awards 2020, and The Asset Triple A Digital Awards 2021 FinTech Start-Up of the Year.

STACS partners with the MAS in Project Greenprint, building an industry-wide blockchain-based ESG Data and Certification Registry.

Job Summary

We are looking for a Backend Software Engineer Intern to join our rapidly expanding Engineering team who is passionate about designing and building great user facing features. You will work in a cross disciplinary setting with both product owners and frontend engineers to enable our Enterprise clients to complete their functional workload on our Vetta platform.

The ideal candidate is a hands-on backend engineer who has a strong background in Java and has worked with many types of RESTful APIs. You will have the opportunity to design and implement backend workflows with an API-first approach for the capital markets and ESG (green financing) sector. You should also have a strong background in web security. You can expect to work with many Cloud-based tools (AWS Cloud) and be open to learning new tools. You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with little supervision in an Agile environment.

You will be a key contributor in transforming the way capital markets of today and green financing of tomorrow function with the web-based frontend applications you build together with internal stakeholders ranging from Customer Success to the Product team.

Your Core Responsibilities

Job Responsibilities
Full software development lifecycle from translating requirements into technical specifications, implementing software code, checking in code for peer review and troubleshootingDesigning and implementing Java code for a modern cloud-based environment using Object Oriented Programming principlesImplement and interface with REST APIs with JavaDesign and interface with relational databases such as MySQL and noSQL databases such as DynamoDB

Basic coding knowledge, in any language (Javascript, Java)Basic understanding of code version control systems such as Git
What You Will Need To Thrive
Value teamwork above all.Natural curiosity to learn.Loves to work with code.Intrinsically motivated personality.High adaptability and strong problem-solving skills.Customer focused mindset.Self-starter who thrives on complexity and independence.

Job Description

Specialist, Big Data Engineering 
 Opportunity to be a part of IT Engineering, Development & Integration organization in Singapore! Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and top-ranked biopharmaceutical company on The Straits Times and Statista’s list of Best Employers in Singapore for two consecutive years (2020, 2021). Join the premier biopharmaceutical company that has been in Singapore for more than 25 years and in AP for over 60 years.
Our IT team operates as a business partner proposing ideas and innovative solutions that enable new organizational capabilities. We collaborate internationally to deliver the services and solutions that help everyone to be more productive and enable innovation.

Join us in the digital health revolution and tackle biggest opportunities and challenges at the intersection of healthcare, information and technology. Become a member of our IT Global Innovation Network in the heart of Singapore with start-up atmosphere and flat, friendly and collaborative environment. Enjoy a reward that technology careers don’t often bring the satisfaction of helping to save lives.

We are seeking energetic, forward-thinking Big Data Developer that will work on the collecting, storing, processing, analyzing and visualizing of huge sets of data of disparate formats and data sources and integrating them into a single data lake for further visualization.

What You Will Do

The primary focus will be on choosing the appropriate big data technology, tool sets and frameworks to deliver optimal solutions to use for these purposes.

Besides great atmosphere and flexible working environment, we also offer
 Competitive remuneration Position in a leading global healthcare company Challenging career Professional growth based on performance Innovative and flexible working environment Wide range of benefits
What You Must Have

To be successful in this role, you will have

Education Minimum Requirement 

MSc Degree or BSc Degree with relevant experience in Computer Science or related field with 3-5 years of relevant experiences.

Required Experience And Skills

Proven record of both backend data engineering and development with the following skills
 Automation and Implementation of end-to-end ETL process of unstructured datasets. Hands on experience in Hadoop, MapReduce, HDFS, Hive, Spark. Experience with various messaging systems, at least one of the following, Kafka, RabbitMQ or its equivalent. Good knowledge in back-end programming languages, Java, Python, shell scripting, SQL, etc. Translate complex functional and technical requirements into detailed design. Minimum 3 years of working experience in both frontend and backend development on data-heavy projects (ie, data engineering and programming experience) Excellent knowledge of relational (SQL) and non-relational databases (no-SQL) as well as Big Data technology like HDFS, Hive, Sparks. Able to design optimal data model for different use-cases with or without Big Data technology. Advance skill in SQL or other data query languages and working experience in tuning queries for data retrieval. Hands-on experience in building data pipelines or ETL flows. Hands-on experience with either two of the following databases Hive, Postgresql, AWS RedShift, DynamoDB, MongoDB. Hands-on experience with AWS Cloud Services. Experience with any data visualisation tools like spotfire, qliksense, Microsoft Power BI, etc a plus. Ability to investigate and propose alternative technology and architecture. Strong project management and organizational skills.
Preferred Experience
 Experience in Git versioning, CI/CD process for deployment of applications (Eg Jenkins). Experience developing dashboards using JavaScript frameworks like Angular, ReactJS, D3.js and others Proficient with programming language like Node.JS or Java EE/Spring platforms.

Who We Are

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What We Look For

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us — and start making your impact today.

Requisition ID R161666

Location: Singapore, Singapore

Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.

As Cloud Security Analyst, you will investigate security events in Thales DIS Cloud. You will collect and analyze events to understand root-cause and mitigate it. If you are curious and tenacious, you are pragmatic and need to understand in details facts, you will enjoy challenges in our Thales DIS Cloud Security Team.

A week in the life of a Cloud Security Analyst:
Solving security issues by collecting, analyzing evidences and mitigating incidents.Supporting the company-defined cloud strategy.Ensuring that responses are appropriate (and automated) according to policies and procedures.Evangelizing and advocating cloud security practices.Supporting Cloud Security engineering in the definition and tuning of security-focused tools and services.Making sure about continuous Thales DIS cloud improvements.Identifying, raising and mitigating security weaknesses on Thales DIS Cloud.
Knowledge, Skills And Experience

LSEG Labs provides a unique opportunity to work in a global company within a team with the culture of a start-up.

LSEG Labs

LSEG Labs investigates the application of new technologies to LSEG financial products and services. Technologies we are investigating or actively using include financial NLP, machine learning and graph databases. The team itself is multi-disciplinary, comprising specialists in financial research, data science, software engineering and design.

Product or Service
Labs are involved in a large range of projects leveraging a multitude of different technologies so a successful candidate is unlikely to be assigned to a single product or service. Information about specific projects would be discussed in the course of the interview process. As a part of our growing Singapore Lab team of data scientists, engineers and UX/UI designers you will be part of our network of like-minded colleagues across Singapore and LondonLabs projects have recently included analytics based on equity sentiment, FX events, trading transaction costs and building a Custom Financial Language ModelOur team offers a great flexible working environment, values curiosity and supports an open and learning culture for all levels of experience & seniority. 
Key Responsibilities
Perform scientific research into the latest methodologies and technologies to solve LSEG customer problems in the field of finance Work with the sustainable finance team to scope and build proof-of-concepts / prototypes using state-of-the-art data science, ML and NLP techniquesConceive, develop, and test algorithms with tools like Python, AWS, etc. Locate, clean and wrangle data. Integrate internal and external data sources using API’s Explain experiment results concisely to other members in the Labs 
Internship duration

Minimum 3 months (from May 2022 onwards)

QualificationsGraduate student in a related technical field, such as computer science, statistics, finance, applied mathematics, physics, , or a related discipline is preferred.Undergraduates who have completed previous internships in the field of Financial Data Science can also apply (should have completed atleast 2 years of undergraduate education)Experience in one or more of these preferred : Natural Language Processing Machine Learning  Deep LearningExperience working with programming and scripting languages such as: Python (preferred)  R MATLABExperience in Relational SQL Databases and Data Science related cloud tools is required
Bonus
Interest or prior experience in the field of sustainable finance is a bonusBig data analytics (Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Impala, Solr, etc.) 
At LSEG, we believe that creating a diverse and inclusive organisation is fundamental to the way we deliver on our promise – and our purpose. You’ll be part of an organisation of over 25,000 people, spanning 70 countries. We recognise the individual perspectives each of our colleagues brings, and our diverse workforce is one of our greatest strengths. In supporting collaboration and creativity and encouraging new ideas across a diverse and inclusive workforce, we can improve how we are driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.

LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support from healthcare and retirement planning to paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.

We are an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Please take a moment to read this privacy notice carefully, as it describes what personal information the London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (“We”) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained, your rights and how to contact us as a data subject.

If you are submitting as a Recruitment Agency Partner, it is essential and your responsibility to ensure that candidates applying to LSEG are aware of this privacy notice.

As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family.
Information TechnologyIT systems form the backbone of our operations. We are looking for individuals with passion and IT expertise, to help us improve the delivery of our systems and services. The Board’s IT systems support a high daily volume of financial transactions for CPF members. In addition to keeping the lights on, the Board also keeps pace with the external environment through innovation in its IT systems.
What you will be working onThe job holder will be responsible for designing, setting up, and maintaining platform solutions and a modern DevSecOps pipeline on the Government Commercial Cloud (GCC). While doing so, the job holder must ensure that the security and compliance requirements of the public service operating context are met. The goal is to enable developers to focus on building applications without paying heed to infrastructure, security and compliance. The Product Development Lab is a new team, set up with the remit to develop software products on the cloud, inhouse and using cloud-native technologies where feasible. In a nutshell, autonomy and flexibility is what’s on offer. Seniority of appointment will commensurate with relevant work experience.

About Us

Intelligent Machines (IM) Team is working on robotics and machine learning software development. You will work with a group of world-class software architects, robotics software specialists, and machine learning specialists on Dyson’s most complex products development.

About The Role

You'll be an experienced software engineer with machine learning concept. Working in an agile cross-functional team, you will contribute to the development of complex features to ensure Dyson continues to create innovative products that will delight our customers.

You'll collaborate with architects, software engineers, machine learning engineers, and platform engineers to help solve the wide and exciting range of edge devices’ challenges posed by the ever expanding Dyson product portfolio.

You'll have a desire to explore and share ideas and techniques across different technical domains and will ideally have expert knowledge of software development for complex, sophisticated systems including deep learning IPU, embedded software, camera/sensors components with a focus on model deployment on embedded system software and cloud computing.

About You
A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Electronics Engineering, Computer Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or robotics engineering related fields with strong quantitative background.Strong knowledge in image classification, segmentation, embedding and feature extractionIndustry experience in building innovative end-to-end machine learning systems2+ years of experience in computer vision/ML application software development and performance tuning.Experience in building, deploying and optimizing machine learning algorithms, especially deep learning and convolutional neural network.Knowledge of at least one area of the model inference acceleration including but not limited to Quantization, Pruning, Distillation, etc.Experience in integration and deployment of computer vision applications onto embedded system products or edge devices is highly desirable.Proficiency in multithreading programming and synchronisation mechanisms.Good command of object oriented programming capability, including speed and overall quality; specifically, must be able to write high performance product quality codes with C++ and PythonFamiliar with STL, boost C++ libraries, design patterns and able to enforce it in day-to-day tasks.Comfortable and familiar with embedded system programming under Linux environment for machine learning model deployment and performance tuning.Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, such as data visualisation, data cleaning, SVM, deep learning deployment etc.Proficient in machine learning libraries, such as OpenCV, dlib, scikit-learn, numpy or scipy, etc.Experience in AWS, Google Cloud or Microsoft Azure cloud service is a plusGood problem-solving and troubleshooting attitude with excellent analytics skillsThe ability to learn continuously and improve oneself.Experience in Agile practices is a plus.Professionalism and excellent communication skills; ability to communicate complex information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Optimism and an excitement about collaborating with teammates and interdisciplinary teams, and technically support development.For a highly experienced candidate, we expect excellent technical guidance skills and the ability to influence the work of others. Benefits

Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.

Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.

Company DescriptionNCS is a leading technology services firm, operating across Asia Pacific, providing services and solutions in consulting, digital, technology, cybersecurity and more. We believe in the power of technology to make extraordinary things happen and to create lasting impact and value for our people, communities and partners.Our diverse 10,000-strong workforce has delivered a wealth of large-scale, mission-critical, and multi-platform projects for governments and enterprises in Singapore and the APAC region. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit with big ideas who is excited in creating technological innovations that impact millions of lives, come and be part of the company that makes the ordinary, extraordinary.
Our Ideal Candidate:At NCS, we aim to offer you more than “just” a job. We are offering you a unique and trailblazing career experience where you will feel empowered to invest in your growth, develop as a leader and make a difference by solving real challenges for the community we live in.
We are looking for a Consulting Analyst who is resilient, passionate, quick on their feet and has relentless energy to thrive in a high-momentum environment. This analyst will join our Consulting practice within NCS Applications.

What can a career at NCS offer you? We don’t just dream of making the world a better place. We make it happen.
We believe that when you join NCS, you can:Make A Difference - Play a part in large-scale, innovative and game-changing transformation programs that directly impact and advance the communities we live in.Elevate Yourself and Stay Relevant – Continuously challenge and upskill via career development and training programs in hot areas such as 5G, advanced analytics, artificial intelligence and cloud.Pivot with Ease – There are multiple career pathways for vertical advancement or lateral moves so you can explore different career options throughout your time here at NCS.Collaborate & Network – You will learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry and work with talented individuals from diverse and broad set of backgrounds.
We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

About The Milken Institute And The Singapore Internship Program

The Milken Institute is a nonprofit, nonpartisan think tank determined to increase global prosperity by advancing collaborative solutions that widen access to capital, create jobs and improve health. We do this through independent, data-driven research, action-oriented meetings, and meaningful policy initiatives.

This Experience Includes Opportunities To

The Milken Institute Singapore Internship Program, in partnership with Partners Group, aims to cultivate the next generation of leaders who are equipped to tackle the issues that shape the global agenda as they enter the financial, investment, corporate, multilateral, or philanthropic sectors.  Interact with high-level business leaders, ambassadors, business leaders, and academic experts as part of our “Global Leaders Speaker Series”  Meet and work with the Milken Institute’s global network of senior executives  Learn from senior leaders at the Milken Institute and Partners Group  Gain insights into the workings of global financial markets through dedicated workshops  Network with an international and diverse group of peers and professionals 
Key Responsibilities
 The Research Intern would participate in projects including but not limited to topics on infectious diseases, cloud technology, and biomedical R&D in Asia.  The Research Intern may also be required to work on other topics that the Asia Center focuses on. The work aims to provide guidance to policymakers, business leaders, and investors in the region.  They will support the projects by organizing outreach for workshops/meetings, as well as conducting primary and secondary research to produce literature reviews, write-ups and sections of papers/reports. She/he will report to and work closely with the Associate for Policy & Programs at the Asia Center. 
Qualifications
 The ideal candidate should have excellent written and spoken English, good analytical skills, strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to work in a multi-disciplinary and cross-cultural environment.  Fluency in Asian languages is a plus.  Currently enrolled or recently graduated from a degree program related to public health, finance, public policy or related fields. Bachelor’s or Master’s graduate is preferred.  Singaporean national is preferred. 
 Internship Duration 

We offer a 6 to 12-month internship with flexibility on the dates. Flexible working arrangements can be made for those enrolled in full-time degree programs. In the event of COVID-19 restrictions, we expect interns to be able to work fully remotely as needed, and join team meetings and other calls virtually.

We are a Cloud Enterprise Business Unit, involved in designing, planning and implementing end-to-end cloud infrastructure for various customers. We are looking to hire a Cloud Architect to embark on a meaningful career with us. You will join MSS on our journey as a key technology partner to our customers to design, solution, and integrate products to build enterprise cloud systems. You will also lead the team to drive standards in design and implementation.
Working closely with the Project Manager, Technical Leads and Software Architect, you will function as part of the MSS Cloud Enterprise Business Unit, to collaborate and deliver a holistic project implementation. 
As the technology landscape is fast evolving, you can expect opportunities to continually advance and further your skillset and knowledge of new technologies. MSS will equip you with the necessary tools for you to reach your potential in both soft skills and technical skills.  Responsibilities:Plan, execute, monitor and control the various Technical aspect of the Project.Manage or participate in new setup or upgrade of system/network infrastructure projects.Responsible for designing and solutioning end-to-end requirements.Participate in RFPs, RFQs, RFIs and preparation of tender proposals.Provide project documentation and reportsDiagnose and rectify technical issue  Requirements:Diploma in IT or with a relevant course2+ years of experience in Cloud Infrastructure implementation/design/solutioningExperience in Windows server OS, Unix/Linux OS in virtual environmentsStrong knowledge and hands-on experience with Virtualisation and Hypervisors, Nutanix platform preferred. NCP/NCM certification will be an added advantage.Strong knowledge in VPN, firewalls and other security appliancesStrong knowledge in network switches/routersStrong knowledge in Container technology and various platformsDeep understanding of various IT functionalities that make up a complete IT System InfrastructureExcellent written and verbal communication to convey technical ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences and contribute within a team environmentPro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinkingAble to work independently as well as in a team and good interpersonal skills

Project Description
We are looking for a talented Cloud Native Developer proficient with building microservices on the back of Pivotal Cloud Foundry. We are looking for someone with strong experience in this area. The person would be a part of an experienced and established team working on a major rebuild of our platform.
Responsibilities
Develop software components with Microservices-based Architecture. Subject matter expert in Cloud Native, Agile, DevOps and CI/CD to all levels of management and project teams. Develop and delivery of Cloud Native Application Development. Participate and contribute actively in cloud native development and standards. Document requirements, codes and prepare reports in the software development lifecycle.
Skills
Must have
 Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent At least 5-7 years of working experience in full-stack software development. Strong knowledge of Cloud Native principles and techniques such as Microservices-based architecture/development, RESTful API development, container-based software deployment, Test Driven Developemnt, Strong Unit and integration testing skill, Spring Boot. Well versed in software system engineering principles and technologies (e.g. Agile, SCRUM, Pair Programming) Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure Strong technical hands-on experience in Java 11+/Microservices apps with frameworks and libraries such as Spring, Hibernate, J2EE, JDBC, JMS, JMX, JUnit, GitLab, Mockito & WireMock, Rabbit MQ/Kafa messaging and Spring Cloud Stream framework. Possess critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present clearly both verbally and in written form, Independent, motivated, reliable and organized. A team player with strong communication skill in English

Languages
English: C2 Proficient

The JAPAC Cloud Engineering Center of Excellence (CE CoE) is a new regional organisation across Japan and Asia Pacific whose role is to accelerate consumption of Oracle Cloud Services by providing a world-class customer experience on the Oracle Cloud. Customers will have access to cutting edge and deep technical subject matter expertise and solutions. The CoE is organized by Technology Domains such as Infrastructure, Packaged Applications, Custom Applications, Data Management, Analytics and others, which will provide relevant subject matter expertise in engagements. The primary goal of these teams is to move customer workloads to production environments to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) for Strategic customer implementations and for the Pitch to Production (P2P) initiative.
We are looking for exceptional candidates for the Custom Applications Domain for the JAPAC CoE. Success is measured providing the field and customers with world class technical subject matter expertise and drive the following outcomes
Cloud consumption growthNew cloud customer acquisitionA high performance, innovative, agile and collaborative teamContinuous improvement of time to value

Skills and Profile
TechnicalCoreDeep architectural experience in designing solution and technical architectures that deliver expected business benefits and prove to be resilient in the face of changing business requirements.Experience architecting, building, and maintaining Cloud applications on cloud platforms e.g., Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google CloudClear success stories of being involved in engagements where monolithic applications were migrated to microservices or where a greenfield microservices development was involved.Understands how to containerize applications and manage the resulting infrastructure lifecyle and is experienced in the use of relevant technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes etc.Fluent in CI/CD tooling and automation capabilitiesExperience with Agile and SCRUM-based projects or working with rapid and iterative technical design/implementation projectsHands on expertise in some of the core Oracle Technology products is required e.g. WebLogic, Oracle Database etc.Exposure to Infrastructure Automation Tools – Terraform, Chef, Ansible, Saltstack, Puppet, etc (Infrastructure As Code) to automate environment deployment is a definite advantage.Experience in developing using REST-style web services / APIs is required.Understand software development at a fundamental level, use the best tools for the job, and always think about the future (at scale) when architecting solutionsExperience building modern streaming architectures leveraging technologies such as: Kafka, Docker, Elasticsearch etc is a definite advantage.Development expertise in one or more software languages, such as Java, Python, Go, JavaScript, C++ or similar.
DesirableExperience in using application integration technologies such as API gateways etc would be an advantage
FunctionalA minimum of 10-12 years experience in software development using a combination of Oracle products and open source tooling to deliver both on premise and cloud applicationsDiscuss key trends and insights and leverage them in driving executive decision-making discussion with customersA passionate self-starter in developing new architectures to solve enterprise challenges. Research, test, and document new technologiesAbility to translate customer requirements into a scope and implementation planUnderstanding of commercial business to effectively position Oracle solutions and why they offer superior TCO vs competitionExcellent communication and presentation skills and highly comfortable speaking across all levels of management and technical audiencesBuild strong relationships with HQ Engineering/Product Management teams to be a customer advocate with HQ Development on required enhancements or in support escalationsClearly able to understand and articulate the Oracle Go-To-Market strategy in JAPAC across the Oracle portfolio
Roles and Responsibilities
Deliver successful Customer Engagements leading to increased consumptiono Collaborate with the cloud architects in the field to define the scope and deliverables of the customer implementations and deliver them as part of a virtual teamo Support the cloud architect in describing the proposed workload migration to the customer thereby gaining their confidence.o Ensure the work delivered is of the highest quality and to the deadlines committed.o Leverage reference architectures and associated assets to automate as much of the migration as possible.o Actively participate in the team meetings undertaking the migration using an Agile methodologieso Transfer skills to customer, partner or other delivery organizations during the migration to ensure a seamless customer experience post the involvement of the CoE team
Thought Leadership and Evangelismo Continuously invest in deepening domain skills by taking relevant training courseso Work closely with HQ Development to gain early competence in new domain solutions.o Have a deep understanding of the competitors equivalent cloud offerings and OCI competitive differentiatorso Speak at industry events and seminars
Cross-collaboration and Stakeholder Engagemento Work closely and collaboratively as one team with other CoE Custom Applications team members, field cloud architects and other domains within the CoE.o Contribute to the relevant Communities of Practice (CoP) to foster better collaboration between CoE and the Fieldo Identify and develop team assets (white papers, blogs, slack support, reference architectures, and software migration components) to help other groups gain relevant experience in deploying their domain solutions on OCI.
Governance & Reportingo Complete all relevant certifications and other mandatory enablemento Fully understand and leverage the systems in place to support customer workload migrations and other strategic engagements.o Provide timely status updates and other reports as required.
This role is can be based in Singapore / ANZ / Hong Kong / India

job_desc:
About Workato

Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it's built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.

Simultaneously, it's a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.

We're proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.

Why join us?

Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.

But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That's why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.

If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!

Also, feel free to check out why:
Business Insider named us an "enterprise startup to bet your career on" Forbes' Cloud 100 recognized us as one of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world Deloitte Tech Fast 500 ranked us as the 17th fastest growing tech company in the Bay Area, and 96th in North America Quartz ranked us the #1 best company for remote workers 

Responsibilities

We are looking for an exceptional Product-Led Growth Intern to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for:
Craft original and compelling content of various formats (e.g. video tutorials, product blog posts, product solution briefs, email newsletters etc) Collaborate with the Product Marketing Team and deliver video projects on time and on brief Meet Workato brand guidelines while adding a creative and unique spin on deliverables Optimize content for SEO, lead conversion, and engagement Brainstorm new story ideas and help plan an editorial calendar with the rest of the Product Marketing team Drive engagement for webinars and events to increase awareness and usage Coordinate with Product, Customer Success and Sales teams to successfully launch product key features 

[This is a 6 month internship. The opportunity to transit into a permanent, full-time position may be offered to you depending on your work performance amongst other factors.]

Requirements

Qualifications / Experience / Technical Skills
Experience generating fresh, purposeful story ideas and content initiatives that drive strategic business objectives Experience editing videos, doing simple motion graphics and kinetic typography Proficient in Adobe Premiere, familiar with Adobe After Effects and Photoshop/Illustrator OR any equivalent applications (we don't discriminate!) Strong understanding of all aspects of video pre- and post-production 

Soft Skills
Ability to articulate a vision or direction for each piece, and come with ideas based on the brief given Excellent communication skills and strong ability to collaborate with others throughout the company, sometimes across international time zones Able to work independently and efficiently to hit short deadlines Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to juggle multiple projects simultaneously Thoughtful team player, a quick learner, and have a "can do" attitude with a growth mindset

Site Name: Field Worker - CHN

Posted Date: Mar 3 2022

Purpose of this role

Consumer Health (CH) has the ambition to be the world’s leading pure play Consumer Healthcare company. The relationship between wellness and technology is deepening as a digitally native generation look for new ways to empower themselves and their wellbeing. To win in this dynamic marketplace we must a) serve the needs of our consumers better than competitors in our local markets; b) drive growth and profitability across all markets and channels; c) win in the market to influence experts who help recommend our products to consumers.

The goal is to drive positive channel growth and profitability, whilst ensuring consistent and coherent commercial execution, by supporting local markets in managing their business in an efficient and effective way.

As Data Technology Engineer, you will manage all aspects of the data systems such as data sourcing, migration, quality, design, and implementation. You will also assist with planning and execution of departmental goals.

Responsibilities
Lead and develop sustainable data driven solutions with current new gen data technologies to meet the needs of our organization and business customersBuild and run forums to train resources across the enterpriseChampion rollout of industry frameworks across the company (e.g. continuous integration)Contribute to strategic roadmap for a technical domainHandle highly ambiguous situationsProactively sponsor process and technology improvementsProvide technical guidance to team membersAct as subject matter expert for a technical domainDevelop frameworks that are used by multiple teams and applicationsParticipate in external speaking engagementsManage team of resources (both full-time associates and/or third party resources)
Why you?

Basic Qualifications

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related fieldMinimal 8 years of experience in Cloud and data engineering is a mustDemonstratable understanding of China from a technology and data technology perspectiveAbility to communicate in Mandarin is ideal as this role involves working closely with vendors from ChinaAble to influence and manage senior business leaders 
Preferred Qualifications

If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or related fieldStrong problem-solving skillsHave implemented scalable solutions that can be leveraged in multiple regions and globallyFamiliarity with Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, API frameworks, NoSQL, Graph DBs, Cassandra, Redis, configuration management (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Terraform), serverless, monitoring (Splunk, Elastic)
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

In Consumer Healthcare we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.

We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.

Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

job_desc:
Cloud Engineer - Singapore
About ThunesThunes' mission is to help businesses and their customers around the world participate in the global economy by providing them fast and affordable cross-border payments. We interconnect banks, payment service providers, mobile wallet operators, money transfer operators and platforms to unlock opportunities for businesses and individuals alike.By providing unparalleled emerging market coverage and smarter transfer solutions for cross border payments, we enable financial inclusivity for those who need it the most.
Our SolutionsWe act as a trusted, neutral aggregator in a deeply fragmented industry. We offer end-to-end payments solutions to tackle the speed, cost-efficiency and accessibility challenges for emerging markets:Business paymentsRemittance processingMass payoutsVirtual accounts / invoice payments
Context of the roleWe're looking for a Cloud Engineer who wants to work in a disruptive, fast-growing and exciting environment. As part of the Infrastructure & Security team, this role will bring you great opportunities to work on various projects, technologies, with a diverse range of teams.The Infrastructure & Security team is responsible for building and maintaining a Cloud Infrastructure which is efficient, scalable and secure. We architect solutions, tools and platforms to solve business needs and operate the Cloud platform running Thunes APIs and services.Our team is passionate about the details and we work very closely with a wide range of stakeholders. The Role (Position Objective/ Summary): Lumen is looking for a talented hands-on Lead Cloud Architect to help accelerate our growing cloud professional services business. The Cloud Application Architect will be responsible for help our customers architect and build highly scalable, cloud native applications on public cloud. The key objectives of this position are:· Work as a technical leader alongside customer business, application and infrastructure teams· Helping customers architect scalable, highly available cloud solutions on private and/or public cloud solutions· Work as a trusted advisor to customers to design their cloud transformation journey
The Main Responsibilities:
· Responsible for supporting the achievement of the sales/revenue targets for cloud services for APAC, as well as driving revenue growth across a broad set of targeted enterprise customers in collaboration with the various RTM and overlay sales teams.· Lead technical and design discussions with IT executives to help enterprises speed their adoption of cloud technologies and practices· Act as trusted advisor to ascertain client requirements and lead architectural discussions to ensure the appropriate solutions proposed are designed successfully. This potentially includes understanding complex applications that may need to sit across several cloud platforms, service levels and technologies.· Develop future state cloud blueprints for key systems along with a transition plan and a roadmap, prototype solutions as needed.· In collaboration with the client engagement teams, assist with running customer cloud transformation workshops. · Field technical questions and educate customers on the value proposition regarding Lumen’s Hybrid Cloud Professional and Managed Services including assessment, consulting, migration and optimization services.· Lend expertise for responses to proposals; specifically addresses any items on RFPs pertaining to Lumen’s Hybrid Cloud solutions.· Support various marketing activities, which may include speaking at industry conferences, presenting webinars, and engaging in community events.· As the cloud expert, provide regular training sessions to enable the Lumen sales and overlay teams as well as technical peers to collectively improve their knowledge and capabilities of Lumen’s Hybrid Cloud offerings.· Investigation and dissemination of competitive intelligence on Lumen’s Hybrid Cloud competitors.· Continually develop deep technical skills across Lumen’s private cloud solutions as well as public cloud services including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud and Alibaba Cloud.· Continually stay abreast of industry Cloud technologies and trends.

 · 5+ years’ experience as a Cloud Solutions Architect.· 5+ years architecting and provisioning solutions on public cloud service providers including AWS, Azure, Google Cloud and Alibaba Cloud.· 5+ years of experience as a technical specialist in Customer-facing roles with the ability to perform pre-sales solutioning· Proven ability to architect, design and implement cloud-based and/or cloud-native solutions· Hands-on experience with containerization platforms and server-less computing like Docker, EKS, Lambda.· Experience with migrations to the cloud from both physical and virtual environments· Knowledge of DevOps methods and CI/CD automation practices· Experience in Configuration Management platforms (e.g., Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible)· Excellent critical thinking and analytical skills.· Excellent written, verbal communication and presentation skills with the ability to present to a variety of external audiences, including being able to interact with senior executives.· Excellent organizational skills and proven experience engaging with and guiding cross-functional and cross-regional virtual teams· Preference for candidates with prior pre-sales experience· Deep expertise and certification across the various public cloud providers i.e., AWS / Azure / Google Cloud / Alibaba Cloud. Product Analyst (SG)

About Sleek

Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions to allow them to focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn we transform those into useful, actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate their growth through smart algorithms.

We are a team of 200 builders from 17 countries, with offices in Singapore, Philippines, Hong Kong, Australia and the UK committed to delivering a delightful experience to our clients!

As a product analyst for Sleek, you will be the product data owner.

Your primary responsibility will be to deliver insights that will support product development. You will take ownership of the tracking strategy, define and implement relevant solutions related to the analytics challenge, and collaborate closely with Product, Design and Tech teams to develop Sleek products. You won't be afraid to approach new, unique problems, and you'll be capable of working with large amounts of data with high attention to detail.

Position Duties
Take full ownership of the tracking strategy and ensure data sanity.Deliver insights to drive product and business decisions.Build and maintain dashboards to make data accessible to numerous stakeholders.Specify and drive research initiatives such as AB testing, Funnel analysis and other experiments.Collaborate with Product Managers to specify features and ensure success metrics are controlled and reviewed.Make the best use of the rest of the data team ressources from data engineers to data scientists to crack complex problems.Participate in key product team meetings to deliver insights and reality checks while capturing data-related opportunities.Work with data engineering, experimentation, data scientists and other technical counterparts in optimising analytics infrastructure and simplifying workflows.Educate product and business stakeholders on analytics/experimentation best-practices and contribute to data-based decision-making.Combine quantitative and qualitative insight to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why.
Performance Standards
Self-starter, independent, motivated and result-oriented team player.5+ years experience in the product analytics space in fast-paced and dynamic environments.You should love engaging people across the company at all levels with your enthusiasm for making positive change.Demonstrated experience with scientific methods in statistics, physics, economics, mathematics, data science or similar.Solid experience in analysis and data wrangling skills, ideally in a big data ecosystem - SQL, python/R.Familiar with data visualization tools - Tableau, or Google DataStudio / PowerBI.Google Analytics - mastery in other tracking technologies can be used as an alternative (e.g. Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different backgrounds in an international environment.Experience with BigQuery and Google Cloud Platform.Fluency in English is mandatory.
More about Sleek!

At Sleek, we work in a fast-paced start-up environment. We have a strong culture built around our five core values: Simplicity, Loyalty, Excellence, Entrepreneurship, Kindness. As a deliberately multicultural team, our team comprises more than 15 nationalities and spoken languages.

We consider the company’s success to be a result of committed individual and team efforts, and are looking to onboard talented and creative people who want to make a difference. Our corporate social responsibility is a passion we take very seriously as an opportunity to make the world a better place. With a strong commitment to also make Sleek a great place to work, we offer a flexible working environment where we empower every team member to be the best they can be - regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age or identity.

If you think you would be a good fit for our mission, we look forward to hearing from you!

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Description

The ASEAN Solution Engineering organisation is building out a solid and diverse team in region. We are seeking a Solution Engineer for our Asean SE team, based in Singapore.

Solution Engineering is the equivalent of sales consulting/pre-sales, who secure the functional and technical selection of Salesforce solution portfolio and assist with the Discovery, Solutioning, Demonstration and Value phases of the sales cycle.

The Solution Engineer is responsible for leading the solution throughout the sales cycle and delivering thought leadership to companies to transform their customer’s experience with our strategic customers in the Singapore market.

The Solution Engineer is an experienced person who works alongside their colleagues, participates in building our team culture and supports their aligned sales team to create solutions for prospects and customers.

To accomplish this, the Solution Engineer must have a strong desire to set the vision translating business objectives into enticing and actionable recommendations. The Solution Engineer will act as a trusted advisor to our customers while aiding the customer’s transformational journey.

Responsibilities
Manage organisations across a range of industries to understand their challenges and goals through focused discovery sessions and workshops.Work closely with current customers and prospective customers as a trusted advisor to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goals.Build trusted relationship with senior executives and key decision makers across Business and Technology To fully understand and clearly articulate the unique benefits of Salesforce to a wide range of customer stakeholders from front line staff right up to C-level executives.  To develop and deliver innovative custom solutions, including solution concepts to key decision makers to address their business issues and needs aligned to business value.  Coordinate and lead the entire solution cycle through close collaboration with a broad range of supporting technical and business resources.  Industry experience, incorporating and developing a point of view based on Salesforce’s solutions.  Display initiative, self motivation and deliver high quality results along with meeting all expectations for both internal and external customers. Must have a proven track record in the development and delivery of differentiated custom solutions and presentations, including technical concepts, to key decision makers to address their business issues and needs.Enjoy working with Start-ups and helping them shape their technology roadmap

job_desc:
Customer Experience Specialist, Singapore

 

About Discovery:

Discovery is the world's leading non-fiction media company with a reach of three billion viewers in 220 countries.

The Direct to Consumer (DTC) group is an Engineering company within the Discovery brand. DTC’s engineering teams build applications for Web, Mobile, Connected TVs and Consoles/STBs covering features like Search, Playback, ML driven Recommendation, Subscriptions, Payments etc. We are building a Global Video Streaming Platform to support a broad collection of Discovery’s brands (Discovery, TLC, Motor Trend, Golf TV, Food Network, Eurosport, and many more) including the recently launched Discovery+. These applications are powered by a fleet of cloud-native microservices for Content Ingestion, Metadata processing, Video encoding & Ad Tech platform on AWS containers & serverless-compute. 

 

Meet Our Team: 

 

we’re recruiting a Customer Experience Specialist for Discovery In Singapore for the APAC market; part of the central Discovery team based in Europe.

The Customer Experience Specialist’s principal responsibility is to coordinate and manage the

Customer Experience set-up for Discovery in the APAC markets-currently in the philippines. In

particular, this role will ensure that both the outsourced aspects of the CX team deliver the highest

quality of service while delivering against the agreed KPIs.

 

The Customer Experience teams are Discovery’s customer-facing voice. Therefore, the successful

candidate will need to ensure that their team’s responses are professional, friendly and aligns with

the brand’s tone of voice and company core-values.

 

Roles & Responsibilities: 

 

Ensure all product bugs and issues are escalated to the right people internally and in a

timely manner

❏ Continuously identify whether existing internal processes and tools could be improved in

order to increase day-to-day operational efficiency

❏ Ensure that the Discovery Customer Experience operation is always staffed according to

need

❏ Provide leadership, training and coaching to the CX agents

❏ Derive and document actionable insights from the reporting to continuously improve the

team’s processes and KPIs

❏ Generate reports for delivery and presentation to other business units and local Discovery

stakeholders

❏ Ensure the FAQ pages are regularly reviewed and up to date with the most current

information

❏ Maintain an internal knowledge base for agents to ensure they are always up to date on

technical issues and other important aspects of the services

❏ A consistent focus on the strategic goals of the department-ensuring those are continually

managed and communicated throughout the CX team

 

What to Bring:

Be a fast learner and identify patterns which could indicate a wider problemDigitally savvy. Clear understanding how to navigate, use, and where required,trouble-shooting customer-facing applications (iOS, Android, Web, TV apps, etc.)Strong communication and organizational skills. Ability to self-organize, take ownership ofa task and drive it through to completionAble to build strong relationships with team members at Discovery but also other staff members in our other regional offices around the worldAble to plan team workloads and work towards tight deadlines Proven ability to work well under pressure with a high degree of flexibility and a positive approachStrong Customer Experience ethos, committed to quality, with the will and enthusiasm to drive improvementsStrong analytical skills, understanding of complex issues, the ability to quickly absorb information and creative problem-solving excellenceAbility to identify and manage risk-escalating and helping to resolve issues as they happenAs part of an international team, fluent English is mandatory A minimum of 3+ years of hands-on practical experience as a manager, team leader and/or trainer for a Customer Experience teamBe a Zendesk super-user. In particular, for a multi-brand Zendesk instance, is a plus Experience on working on high-traffic platforms and websites While not required, experience working on a video-on-demand streaming service would be preferred. 

What We Offer:

A Great Place to workEqual opportunity employerFast track growth opportunities 

Our Values: 

Discovery is governed by our eight guiding principles:

We Are... One Team, Creative Dreamers, Doers. Consumer Obsessed. Global, Quick & Agile, Purposeful and We Do the Right Thing 

Discovery’s Guiding Principles define the distinctive character, spirit and attitude of our organization. They inspire how we design our future and recruit talent.

 

Diversity & Inclusion: 

Disclaimer: Discovery Communications, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Discovery is committed to being an employer of choice, not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. To that end, we strive to recruit and maintain a workforce that meaningfully represents the diverse and culturally rich communities that we serve. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disabled status or, genetic information.

 

We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including but not limited to all local Fair Chance Ordinances.

Exciting DevOps and Cloud Job opportunity for Freshers

LogicFocus is one of the fastest growing DevOps and Cloud Consulting start-ups and a recognised market leader in DevSecOps and Cloud training, consulting and product development.

We are looking for Singaporean fresh degree/master degree graduates from any discipline who are interested to develop a career in:
 DevOps DevSecOps
Requirements
 Degree in any disciplines. Have passion to learn new technologies. Good communication and presentation skills. Demonstrated ability to work in a team and independently.
Responsibilities
 Training will be given in DevSecOps and Cloud Computing by LogicFocus Create CI/CD pipelines and manage the DevOps tools Work closely with customer team to onboard their applications to DevOps methodology
We’re looking for people to join our Hire-Train-Deploy program – to simplify the Software Development process and automate the software delivery.

Upon successful hiring we will be training the candidates on DevSecOps and Cloud, deploy them to DevSecOps Projects.

We offer a rare opportunity to join a thriving, fast-paced, multi-cultural environment and be part of a truly exciting journey. You will be at the forefront of innovation, joining the only DevSecOps and Cloud startup in Singapore that tackles a global market.

About LogicFocus

We are a leading technology transformation consulting services provider and system Integrator across South East Asia with our headquarters in Singapore. We enable our customers’ success by providing latest cutting edge technology solutions, driving digital transformation journeys, adopting Cloud/Agile/DevSecOps/Cyber Security solutions which help them to improve their working methods continuously

Our focus is to be a partner in our customer’s success journey instead of a working like an IT outsourcing vendor. We would help the customers as a channel partner that audits, leads, and manages improvements to a customer's technology stack and business processes. We provide consultative services to build, optimize, integrate and configure your technology platforms, Datacentre, On-premise and Cloud environments

LogicFocus is a proud partner for Cloudbees for software/plugin development. Also, we are working with multiple product vendors and support an extensive list of customers

At Ericsson, you can be a game changer! Because working here isn’t just a deal. It’s a big deal. This means that you get to leverage our 140+ years of experience and the expertise of more than 95,000 diverse colleagues worldwide. As part of our team, you will help solve some of society´s most complicated challenges, enabling you to be ‘the person that did that.’ We’ve never had a greater opportunity to inspire change; setting the bar for technology to be inclusive and accessible; empowering an intelligent, sustainable, and connected world.

Our Exciting Opportunity:

We are now looking for an UDM Integration Engineer, to analyze, prepare, implement and verify the configuration and integration of a node, network and/or system. Your scope of work could include the scenarios of introduction, upgrade expansion, functionality and capacity. Your work will in part form our customer legacy.

You will be leading integration activities towards the end customer, working closely with customer engineers, project managers and solution architectsPlan the implementation of the product configuration / integration work Execute product configuration Execute integration and migration work Prepare system test, module test and accept test You will work to identify and drive improvements Post project activities E2E technical understanding Execute test Scripting & coding Knowledge sharing, documentation and collaboration skills

Education: Degree in BS Electronics and Communications Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent Minimum of 5 years Telecom Experience and including at least 3 years in a customer facing role. Very good knowledge of User Data Management (UDM) and Subscriber Data Management (SDM) domain (HSS, CUDB, CCSM, CCDM, EDA)Perform integration and upgrades in both native and OpenStack Cloud/VMware/Network Function Virtualization environmentKnowledge of the Packet Core , e.g. EPC (MME,EPG), IMS/VoLTE will be advantageous Telco Industry understanding Knowledge of 2G, 3G, 4G and 5G Technologies and 3PP standards - 5G EPC and 5GC Strong Network integration experience and proven experience of troubleshooting in the above environments Strong track record in engaging with customers and problem solving as needed Creating & innovating Applying expertise & technology Analytical learning and researching skills Delivering results & meeting customer expectations You will need excellent planning and organizing skills
What´s in it for you?

With over 90,000 employees across 180+ countries, we have a culture that respects and supports your ambitions, in alignment with our values of Respect, Professionalism and Perseverance. Ericsson is very passionate about learning and development, supports mobility and flexible working hours. We are also committed to diversity and to be a responsible and relevant driver of positive change. We also offer outstanding career development, benefits and training programs to provide an empowered career in a connected world.

We are proud to announce at Ericsson Singapore, our employees have once again voted us as a Great Place to Work® and we have been officially Certified™ in 2021. Every year, more than 10,000 organizations from over 60 countries partner with the Great Place to Work® Institute for assessment, benchmarking and planning actions to strengthen their workplace culture and this Certification acknowledges our employees value their employee experience and our workplace culture.”

Ericsson is continuing to hire for all open roles with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. Everyone new to the team, along with our current staff, will temporarily work from home until it is safe to return to our offices.

 Job Category Sales Job Details 

What is a Solution Engineer at Salesforce?

Also known as a “Presales Consultant,” “Sales Consultant,” or “Sales Engineer”, the Solution Engineer is a key member of the sales team, responsible for leading all aspects of the technical sale, as well as delivering product, technology and industry thought-leadership to companies wishing to digitally transform their business processes and their customer experiences.

The Solution Engineer is an experienced industry expert who partners with the sales team, professional services team and customer success team to configure, build, demo, architect and articulate the value of our innovative industry solutions to our prospects and customers. In short, it is the Solution Consultant’s role to secure product/technology selection.

To accomplish this, you should have a strong desire to set an industry-specific digital vision, translating business objectives into relevant, actionable and value-based recommendations, plus importantly to become a trusted technical advisor to our prospects/customers while aiding their transformational journey.

Responsibilities
 Manage enterprise organisations across a range of industries, with a focus on telecommunications in the Philippines, to understand their challenges and goals through focused discovery sessions and workshops in order to establish Salesforce as a preferred strategic partner Work closely with current customers and prospective customers as a trusted advisor to deeply understand their unique company challenges and goalsBuild trusted relationships with senior executives and key decision makers across Business and Technology Develop and deliver differentiated custom solutions and presentations, including technical concepts, to key decision makers to address their business issues and needs.Fully understand and clearly articulate the unique benefits of Salesforce to a wide range of customer stakeholders from front line staff right up to C-level executivesPresent compelling Salesforce & partner solutions while supporting relationships with customers and partnersCoordinate and lead the entire solution cycle through close collaboration with a broad range of geographically distributed supporting technical and business resourcesDisplay initiative, self motivation and deliver high quality results along with meeting all expectations for both internal and external customers.Have a strong interest in growing your career and participating in our internal training programs and mentorship initiatives.Willing and able to travel occasionally
Attributes/Experience Required
Track record of solution engineering, consultancy, delivery or training success for a software solution organisation. We are open to a variety of backgrounds for the roleExposure to Design Thinking, Consulting methodologies, and Enterprise Architecture would be an added advantageDeep industry expertise - Telecommunications is a plusTranslate the unique business requirements of customers within multiple industries into a compelling vision and roadmap for our customers based on Salesforce’s solutionsProven consultative sales solution skills as well as superior written and verbal communication skills that includes the ability to create, deliver, and defend a proposal proposal point of view that clearly articulate value for the customerProven time management skills in a dynamic team environmentAbility to work as part of a team to solve problems in varied, fast paced environmentsInquisitive, practical and passionate about technology and thought leadershipGood at searching out information, experimenting, and problem solvingComfortable with a high degree or ambiguity at timesA broad understanding of and an ability to articulate the benefits of Cloud Computing, SFA, Service & Support, Marketing and Mobile solutionsKnowledge of related applications, relational database and web technology
