 Job Category Customer Success Group Job Details 

The Enterprise Architect (also known as Program Architect) is an instrumental service at Salesforce Industries, partnering with our leading customers to fully maximise their investment in the Salesforce Industries out-of-the-box product and implement the platform as it was designed. This ensures our customers deploy a solution that is fast to market, highly performant and scalable, and allows them to realize the overall business objectives of their digital transformation program.

Built In Partnership With Salesforce, It Is 100% Native And Additive To The Salesforce Platform With 3 Fundamental Layers

Salesforce Industries serves the world’s largest companies with the most complete and innovative suite of industry-focused, customer-centric & omni-channel solutions.
 An extensive industry-specific data model.  A complete set of industry-specific business processes and integrations.  A full range of industry-specific omni-channel experiences and apps (including sales, marketing, service, enterprise product catalog, CPQ, contract management, order management and commerce solutions). 
Salesforce Industries has invested over $100m in R&D to extend Salesforce and deliver these industry-specific capabilities as out-of-the-box products. This has all been designed and built in complete collaboration with the Salesforce engineering teams.

These out-of-the-box products support our customers’ rapid time-to-market, simplified processes, increased agility and ongoing innovation. All at a lower cost of ownership to the business. However, these business advantages are only gained if the out-of-the-box product is fully leveraged, implemented properly and deployed as designed. This demands a complete and comprehensive understanding of the out-of-the-box product supported by strong program governance and deep enterprise architecture experience.

This is where Salesforce Industries’ Program Architects delivers a critical service. With your unique combination of deep Salesforce, Salesforce Industries, Enterprise Architecture and Industry experience, you have the knowledge and expertise to ensure that our customers are fully leveraging their investment in the platform and taking full advantage of the out-of-the-box functionality.

As a Salesforce Industries Program Architect, you will have 10+ years of industry experience, undergo the most rigorous and comprehensive Salesforce and Salesforce Industries training, collaborate with our engineering teams on a daily basis, and have complete coverage of the Salesforce Industries out-of-the-box product at every layer.

Salesforce Industries' Program Architects are aware of every element of the industry data model, every business process available in the library, and every component of the omni-channel user experience. This means that when our customers have a business requirement that needs addressing, you understand how to deliver it using the out-of-the-box capabilities and avoid the need for customisation.

As a Salesforce Industries Program Architect, you will not be an additional resource on the project team or compared to a traditional services role. Rather, your role brings a very specific range of strategic, industry, Salesforce, Salesforce Industries, and CRM architecture skills to the table. Your value maps directly to the business value gained through leveraging the Salesforce Industries product 100% with the resulting rapid time-to-market, simplified processes, increased agility and ongoing innovation. Not to mention the cost avoidance of customization, deployment delays, errors with mission critical systems, and the inability to take advantage of ongoing innovation and upgrades.

From our experience, the overall success of any digital transformation program, which is often a significant investment, is directly tied to the strategic involvement of a Salesforce Industries Program Architect from the start.

Responsibilities
 As a Salesforce Industries Program Architect, you are partnering with our leading customers to fully maximise their investment in the Salesforce Industries out-of-the-box product and implement the platform as it was designed.  You will be responsible for ensuring our customers deploy a solution that is fast to market, highly performant and scalable, and allows them to realise the overall business objectives of their digital transformation program.  It will be your responsibility to collaborate with our customers full-time, at the most senior level, to understand and execute against their long-term business strategy.  You must build relationships at CxO, Business, IT and Enterprise Architecture level within the customer. Being able to engage and influence leaders across the customer team is critical to this role.  You will be responsible for the overall Salesforce Industries architecture and design, providing best practice guidance and patterns to our customers, their partners and the implementation team.  You will take a lead role in ongoing governance meetings and have the confidence to voice your opinions and challenge issues that you feel impact the program’s success.  You will maintain a deep knowledge and understanding of the industry vertical, and continually undergo the most vigorous product training and certification.  You will be responsible for maintaining a complete awareness of the Salesforce Industries out-of-the-box product allowing you to support a product-led design approach from your customer.  You will maintain your certification across all enabling platforms including Salesforce, Salesforce Industries and Amazon AWS.  You will establish a direct line into the Salesforce Industries Product Management, on behalf of the customer, representing their needs and aligning on future roadmap and new release priorities.  You will contribute to the growth of Program Architecture program globally, mentoring new team members in being successful in the role. 
Experience
 10+ years of enterprise architecture consulting experience in the Energy & Utilities (Oil & Gas / Power distribution ) industries spanning large organizations and enterprise platforms such as Salesforce, Salesforce Industries, Oracle, SAP , Siebel & Microsoft  5+ years of experience as a Senior Architect and/or CTO in a mid-to-large sized organization. Successfully demonstrated leadership and influential skills in a complex organization.  Experience with key areas of enterprise architecture including Cloud, Integration Technologies, Master Data Management, AWS and CDNs.  Hands-on experience with Agile Implementation Frameworks.  Proven ability to analyze, design, and optimize business processes via out-of-the-box product, technology and integration.  Success in guiding customers and colleagues in rationalizing and deploying emerging technologies that drive increased business value.  Accomplished speaker with the ability to evangelize best practices at various levels within a large organization, SIs or a combination of the two.  Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Able to effectively develop materials that are appropriate for the audience.  Strong presentation skills. Able to effectively present and defend a point of view to a variety of audiences.  Ability to work independently and be a self-starter across the following domains: front- and back-end solution architecture, web/mobile solutions, development and release management strategies, change management, and direct leadership in designing solutions that meet or exceed customer needs.  Travel to the client site an average of 30% but may be higher or lower based on the client engagement. 
Technical Skills
 Salesforce Industries Certification Preferred.  Salesforce Certification Preferred (Admin, Developer, Sales and Service Clouds).  Prior platform experience at SAP / Oracle EBS / Microsoft Dynamics / other ERP suite  Product Catalog and CPQ experience (Apttus, Siebel, Amdocs).  Extensive experiences with integration platforms that support large, mission-critical volumes.  Understanding of Integration Patterns and Enterprise Component architecture.  Understanding of DevOps and Release Management for large transformation projects.  Understanding of Mobile and Lightning Style frameworks and channels.  Ability to get hands-on to solve problems and demonstrate certain development patterns.  Ability to use Google and Microsoft productivity tools. 
Desired Certifications / Qualifications
 Salesforce Certification Preferred (Admin, Developer, Sales and Service Clouds).  TOGAF and Industry Architecture qualifications.  Solid understanding of industry regulations such as HIPAA and GDPR.  Agile Methodology certification such as Scaled Agile Framework. 
 Accommodations

Job description:

 Job Description The KPMG financial services advisory team assists banks and capital market sectors in managing their day-to-day business challenges and developments. We support our financial services clients on multiple diverse consulting projects that include: 

  Business growth (e.g. market entry, customer insights, merger and acquisitions support)  Operational process improvements  Organisation-wide functional (re)design  Change management and project management  Digital and technology enablement  Programme management support Data driven transformation   As KPMG embarks on a rapid growth strategy to become the preferred data driven strategy execution firm in South East Asia, we established the propositions in data driven transformation, and cloud & data center-of-excellence for all the different line of businesses to serve our clients. The ideal candidate should have experience in digital and data driven transformation while working for cloud providers, consulting firm or financial services organisations. 

 This role involves: 

  Champion Cloud Technology & Data Centre-of-Excellence vision, strategy, and capabilities across data driven transformation proposition  Build new market entry strategies and drive transformative changes in our clients  Engage with C-Level executives across a diverse geo and to influence strategic solution development and deployment that unifies cloud into unique and differentiated offerings to support global revenue growth and adoption/utilization targets  Lead and deliver complex client engagements that analyze technology environment, enterprise specifics and requirements for large-scale businesses  Support the safe delivery of large transformation projects for KPMG by designing the safe and engineered delivery of change  Articulate the value-add and business impact of technology solutions to clients of different levels, across technical, functional and security aspects  Responsible for sales and conversion of large transformation projects from end to end bid management to enterprise solution design and delivery  Act as the SME within KPMG to design complex transformation change across the clients’ operating model, and champion for data drive transformation propositions and frameworks   ⠀ The ideal candidate should possess: 

  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information System, IT or equivalent  Minimum 15 years of working experience in IT system implementation with proven experience on delivering transformation projects such as system modernization, process re-design, operational efficiency, branch transformation  Demonstrated experience in leading the strategy, plan and design of IT roadmap and solutions to support business and operations across the organization  Demonstrated ability in providing technical leadership partnering with internal teams as well as key external business partners  Excellent working experience with cloud technology and providers such as MS Azure, GCP, Ali Cloud, Tencent Cloud, etc.  Professional certifications in AWS, MS Azure, Government Commercial Cloud (GCC) or Government Private Cloud (GPC) will be an added advantage  Proficiency in Python, Java, SQL, AI related frameworks (NLTK, Spacy, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow)  Experience in large data warehouses, Big Data technologies, infrastructure components, ETL/ ELT and reporting/analytic tools  Experience in designing solutions utilizing one or more emerging technologies (e.g., cloud, AI and machine learning) to deliver business value which are secure, scalable, reliable and effective for adoption  Strong client and stakeholder management abilities coupled with excellent communication, written, analytical, organisational and problem-solving skills

Our CompanyHitachi Vantara is part of the Global Hitachi family. We balance innovation with an open, friendly culture and the backing of a long-established parent company, known for its ethical reputation. We guide customers from what’s now to what’s next by unlocking the value of their data and applications to solve their digital challenges, achieving outcomes that benefit both business and society.
In Hitachi Vantara, we are committed to ensure that our customer’s data are protected in all the projects we delivered. We are looking for an Enterprise & Cloud Data Security champion that will work with project teams to secure different components in our customers architecture landscape. You will ensure that all bolts and nuts are tightened, there are no leakages; all the doors are locked, and windows shut so that our customers are able to sleep soundly at night. You will be the Guardian of the Data Universe.

Requirements:Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or related fields.Worked on securing different parts of an on-premise and cloud solution.Worked on a cloud platform, Azure, AWS, GCP etc.Implemented SSL for Enterprise & Open-Source Products and Tools.Worked with Single Sign On solutions, eg KeyCloak, IdentityServer, Azure Active Directory etc.Worked with security protocols like OpenID Connect, Kerberos, SAML 2.0, OAuth 2.0 etc.Understanding of ways to do encryption at rest, in use and at transit.Experience in O/S and database security.Understanding of networks and firewalls, and penetration tests.Strong Trouble-shooter.

Good to have, but not necessary:Understanding of Enterprise Access Management solutions, eg Okta, CyberArk etc.Understanding of SQL ingestion, and how to prevent them.Able to code in Python or a scripting language.Able to write SQL.Understanding of data ingestion.Experience in Machine Learning in log analysis, network data anomalies etc.

We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

JOB SUMMARY
We are a Cloud Enterprise Business Unit, involved in designing, planning and implementing end-to-end cloud infrastructure for various customers. We are looking to hire a Cloud Architect to embark on a meaningful career with us. You will join MSS on our journey as a key technology partner to our customers to design, solution, and integrate products to build enterprise cloud systems. You will also lead the team to drive standards in design and implementation.
Working closely with the Project Manager, Technical Leads and Software Architect, you will function as part of the MSS Cloud Enterprise Business Unit, to collaborate and deliver a holistic project implementation. 
As the technology landscape is fast evolving, you can expect opportunities to continually advance and further your skillset and knowledge of new technologies. MSS will equip you with the necessary tools for you to reach your potential in both soft skills and technical skills.  RESPONSIBILITIES
Plan, execute, monitor and control the various Technical aspect of the Project.Manage or participate in new setup or upgrade of system/network infrastructure projects.Responsible for designing and solutioning end-to-end requirements.Participate in RFPs, RFQs, RFIs and preparation of tender proposals.Provide project documentation and reportsDiagnose and rectify technical issue  REQUIREMENTS Minimally with Diploma/Degree in IT 2+ years of experience in Cloud Infrastructure implementation/design/solutioningExperience in Windows server OS, Unix/Linux OS in virtual environmentsStrong knowledge and hands-on experience with Virtualisation and Hypervisors, Nutanix platform preferred. NCP/NCM certification will be an added advantage.Strong knowledge in VPN, firewalls and other security appliancesStrong knowledge in network switches/routersStrong knowledge in Container technology and various platformsDeep understanding of various IT functionalities that make up a complete IT System InfrastructureExcellent written and verbal communication to convey technical ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences and contribute within a team environmentPro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinkingAble to work independently as well as in a team and good interpersonal skills
industry: Computer Hardware, Computer Networking, Computer Software

job_desc:
NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 55 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation. For more information, visit ncs.co
We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated
Your scope should mainly cover:Work closely with the project team to develop and validate the data analytics applications under the guidance of the Product ManagerConduct detail requirements gathering and clarify requirements with the end user(s), when required, to formulate, translate and refine their business questions into technical and analytical requirementsAssist with the design and maintenance of interactive dashboards as well as the associated authorisation that meet business, technical and security requirements, using the established processes and available tools on the Authority's Enterprise DataAnalytics Platform, within the stipulated timeframe and allocated effort Implement the interactive dashboards in accordance to the design specifications and work closely with the data integration team to extract, transform and load the required data from the sources systems into the data store.Ensure optimal design of the dashboards/reports with due consideration for user- experience and system performanceWork closely with project team to analyse data, identify trends and build machine learning models during development phase to address business needsProvide and maintain documentations according to the Authority's Quality Management

Minimum one (1) year of data manipulation experience in SQL. Experience in dimensional modelling, data warehousing techniques (e.g. data cleansing, merging and other data manipulation tasks) would be advantageous. Knowledge of methodology and techniques in software testing, and techniques in security vulnerability assessment and testing would be advantageous. Possesses good planning and coordination skills with strong ability to work independently, efficiently and as a team, manage timelines and expectations, and is responsible and conscientious in producing high quality deliverables (which mimimally include documentation, presentations, and prototypes). Possesses strong writing, verbal communication and presentation skills.

Cloud and Infrastructure Architect is responsible for designing and implementing the underlying on-premise cloud and hosting architecture as well as integration of IT infrastructure components to support the Singapore government future cloud computing requirements to meet business requirements and comply with IT governance framework. This requires envisioning the client’s services, insight into client’s business, leading architecture planning, technology roadmaps and coordinating technology consultants in the design and implementation of the solutions while planning for risk and growth. Candidates may be expected to take on operation support role after the completion of the project implementation.

What to Expect:Architect complex cloud/hosting infrastructure solutions for the Singapore government.Identify technology trends especially with major vendors that may support or impede the success of the business.Evaluate and identify appropriate technology platforms for delivering the client’s services and work with the division’s technical team to produce integrated platforms and service designs.Participate in tendering and deployment of new or enhanced cloud/hosting infrastructureMaintain up-to-date knowledge of technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies, and software development best practices.Participate in development of technology standards and best practices to help agencies in their deployment of applicationsEngage stakeholders and present in forums on technical solutions and best practices.Manage system integration efforts to ensure that the entire system is built in an efficient and robust manner towards a high level of maintainability, reliability and availability.Support systems to ensure high degree of usability that is balanced with stringent security requirements.Operating and supporting the IT infrastructure and services implemented to meet prescribed service levels.Develop and implement appropriate central ICT governance as well as performance management framework, to ensure continuous improvement.Review and improve work processes based on best practices in industry, specific to service support operations for Government IT infrastructure.Ensure that project implementation and operations are aligned to Government technology standards and policies.
Qualifications:Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplinesMinimum 10 to 12 years of relevant IT experience in deploying and managing complex IT infrastructure systems and services, preferably in a Singapore public sector organisation.Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience, with proven records of having utilized architect design capabilities in the area of infrastructure management for both on premise and Cloud workloads.Working experience in IT operations either in an external IT service provider organisation or internal IT department within an organisation is an added advantage.Have good and current working experience with technologies such as virtualization, cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, GCP, Open Stack and others, networking, security, storage, hyperconverged platforms, and software defined network.Strong technical skills with working knowledge and experience in ICT infrastructure architecture including server technologies, virtualization, middleware, service-oriented architecture, database and storage technologies.
Recommended Qualifications:Cloud Certified Administrator (any platform)MCSA/MCSE for several key Microsoft productsVCP for VMware

Work closely with the team and clients to deliver solutions that solve our clients’ business challenges and cultivate relationships with clients’ executives through both in-person meetings and other communication channels.Provide leadership, inspiration, mentorship, guidance and career development to members of your team. Identify and coach future leaders of the organisation.Scale your team by capitalising on opportunities for increased effectiveness and efficiency by driving key automation and productivity initiatives.Execute projects involving quantitative analysis, industry research and strategy development.Be quantitative in your approach to team strategy using data to make strategic changes as the team size grows.Create and achieve a sales pipeline to achieve the targets set for the segment.

Job Description (Roles & Responsibilities)
· Serve as a key technical member of the Solutions Architecture team in helping to enable partners and ensure partner success in building partner practice, capabilities, and solutions on the Huawei Cloud platform.· Scope each partner engagement, with attention towards clear and well-defined objectives and success criteria.· Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful partner engagements validating POCs, SOWs, new solutions and architecture designs.· Demonstrate vision, creativity, business acumen and deep Huawei Cloud knowledge in jointly developing industry and vertical partner solutions.· Own each technical enablement and engagement, and help ensure a timely and successful delivery of value. (delivery of actual solutions to be done by Huawei partners)· Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the solution architect community.· Understand the Huawei market segments, customer base, and industry verticals.· Understand and exploit internal Huawei systems.· Share partner and customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive improvements.
As a Partner Solution Architect focused on our strategic alliance partners within Huawei Cloud, you will have the opportunity to help shape and take initiative to produce results on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of the Huawei Cloud platform across our partner community.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
· Be familiar with the functions, principles, and architecture of one or more domains of the public cloud or private cloud. Basic programming knowledge or development experience is preferred.· Highly technical and analytical, possess 8+ years of current solution architecture (implementation/consulting) experience· Experience in technology/software sales or pre-sales consulting.· Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers· Ability to communicate fluently in Mandarin and English, in technical and business settings

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
· Experience working within partner and consulting organizations· Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud· Previous experience with Huawei Cloud is a plus· Experience with a programming or scripting language.

job_title: AWS Cloud Consultant Graduate Programme (Fresh Grads are Welcomed To Apply!)
job_desc:
As an FDM consultant, you could be working with our clients across a number of functions and departments in order to help them achieve their business objectives. You will receive full training at the FDM academy, as well as ongoing professional development and support, to ensure you are able to start making a difference from day one! FDM is a FTSE 250 employer operating across Asia-Pacific, the UK, mainland Europe and North America. We provide various opportunities for our consultants to work in technical roles alongside some of the world’s biggest brands including RHB, Ernst & Young and Avaloq to name a few.
Your career starts here.FDM has teamed up with AWS re/Start to offer a full-time skills development programme, open to graduates who are looking to jumpstart their career working in Cloud Computing Engineering.The AWS Cloud and IT Fundamentals online training will allow you to gain the technical skills you need for an entry-level cloud role. You will have the opportunity to learn through real-world, scenario-based applications, labs and coursework, while also focusing on professional skills such as adaptive communication, time management, resume building, and interviewing to prepare for employer meeting and interviews.
As an FDM Cloud Computing Engineer Consultant, you will gain invaluable hands-on experience while helping large organizations make the shift from traditional IT methods and overseeing all technological tasks involving the cloud. You will have the opportunity to create breakthrough cloud environments, as well as diagnose and fix issues to improve existing cloud-based systems to revolutionize business.
Once you have completed training, you will work with one or more of our clients in Singapore for a minimum of two years. A career in Cloud Computing Engineering suits those who are interested in understanding the root cause of a problem and are passionate about learning outside of their current knowledge set. After the two years, you can remain with FDM or you may have the opportunity to transition to an in house role at FDM or to carry on working with the client as a member of their permanent team. What we offer you:Industry recognised training and qualificationsKey skills development e.g. stakeholder management, communication, planning and Microsoft ExcelA minimum of two years commercial experience working with some of the world’s most reputable organisationsMentoring and on-going support throughout your career with FDM Essential experience and skills required:Eligible to work in SingaporeExcellent communication skills in English and an ability to build relationshipsAmbitious, with a drive to succeed within the technology industryEducated to degree levelStrong analytical ability and problem solving skillsGood decision making skills within fast-paced environmentsBe able to commit to two years with FDM upon completion of the training period
How can I apply?With the world at your fingertips, all you have to do is click apply. To find out more about our graduate opportunities, please visit https://www.fdmgroup.com/en-sg/sg-home/

Main Responsibilities
 Implement and improve monitoring and alerting. Build and maintain highly available systems on Kubernetes. Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines.

The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) Operations and Support team is seeking accomplished and passionate individuals to lead and evolve our customers’ cloud journey.
As an Escalations Manager, you will bring business critical product issues to resolution and channel customers back to normal Support stream. You will strive to provide the highest level of customer support and satisfaction through collaborating with service teams from multiple Oracle lines of business in resolving product related issues that have a significant business impact on cloud customers.
We are looking for Escalation Managers to lead and manage complex customer issues and situations. The ideal candidate will have proven ability to communicate effectively in high-pressure situations, work on and lead cross-functional teams such as Support and Operations, Consulting, Engineering and Product Management. S/he is a forward-thinking problem solver with a solutions-oriented mindset and with a potential to deeply understand the impact of technical challenges. In addition, s/he has strong communication skills to clearly articulate high-level technical solutions and drive technical decisions to solve challenging technical and business problems.
Are you keen in learning how an end-to-end cloud infrastructure works? Are you passionate about making customers successful? Are you a customer advocate who enjoys building and establishing strong relationships and credibility? Are you excited about diving in and resolving customer issues, and willing to engage directly with Executives in high-profile situations?
ResponsibilitiesPrincipally responsible to own communication to customers and other teams within Oracle during critical incidentsProvide a single voice to the customer (internal or external) throughout the full lifecycle of an incident, from inception to resolution and corrective actionOperate efficiently in a demanding environment, maintain composure, demonstrate leadership, and communicate in an exemplary mannerWork as one member of a global team. Be able & willing to assist in work originating in other regions and be open to handing off your work to your team members for follow-the-sun issuesEngage and lead cross-functional and geographically diverse teams to develop and execute action plans while addressing critical situationsManage timelines and resource engagement to drive resolution to critical/challenging customer issues in a cross-functional environmentTrack and communicate status and resolution to all customer and oracle stakeholders in a factual, professional, timely and consistent mannerTechnical aptitude sufficient to obtain OCI certification(s) as requested/requiredAbility to communicate complex ideas and topics to multiple audiences at the appropriate depth for each
RequirementsBA/BS in Computer Science with minimum 5-10 years' experience in customer engagement, customer-facing service delivery and/or incident management roles. Fresh graduates are welcomed to apply and will be considered for a junior positionStrong verbal and written communications skills with prior experience in a customer facing role. Proficiency in written and spoken Mandarin or Japanese will be preferred, this is required to work with multiple regional stakeholders in various locations, where communication is conducted mainly in Mandarin or JapaneseAbility to multitask and prioritize with a goal of driving issues to closureKnowledge and proficiency with Infrastructure as a service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) in a Public or Private Cloud environment

job_title: Cloud Business Practice and Commercial Management
job_desc:
Due to the current situation of COVID-19 and the visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently looking for candidates who do not require work sponsorship.
APAC Tech Cloud Business Practice and Commercial ManagementThe Commercial Manager is a member of the APAC Commercial Manager & Business Practice Team within the Oracle Tech Cloud Opportunities. The team specializes in commercial negotiation expertise and is driven to create a win-win outcome for the customer and Oracle from a commercial perspective.
The Commercial Manager Team ensures the sales team creates and executes flawlessly a coherent negotiation strategy backed by a solid concession plan. They are able to confidently engage customers in supporting sales in commercial negotiation and clarification of the commercial terms and conditions of the contract, thus, demonstrating the value of the Oracle commercial terms and conditions. The team will be able to leverage from their collective commercial experience around the region, to ensure they are continuously developing and providing feedback into Oracle. The overall objective of the Commercial Manager Team is to create and lift the commercial DNA of any team they engage with, and drive a value based not discount based customer commercial engagement. 
RoleYour role as Commercial Manager is to enable the application sales teams by pro-actively engaging in nominated accounts and driving commercial ‘thought-leadership’ in the sales cycle. You are a highly skilled and self-motivated commercial practitioner.
 As Commercial Manager you must be at the forefront of Oracle’s Business and Deal crafting practice, which will involve an intimate understanding of the commercial instruments at hand, including the various contractual frameworks. You should be comfortable engaging various stakeholders including procurement and legal teams, business sponsors through to CxO Level, both within the customer’s IT, business departments and within Oracle. Being part of a divisional team, travel will be expected to various customer/Oracle locations. Passion, curiosity, commercial acumen, excellent negotiation & objection handling and exceptional communication skills are required. ResponsibilitiesNegotiate and agree Tech Cloud commercial terms for strategic transactions.Convey a compelling and convincing case for Oracle’s Commercial terms and conditions.Ability to engage in multiple, complex multi-dimensional commercial negotiations at once.Facilitate and coordinate internal discussions among functional stakeholders (Sales, General Counsel, Business Approvers, Revenue Recognition, Deal Specialists etc.)Able to engage and build relationships with sales leaders, sales developers, sales teams within region.Drive commercial ‘best practice’ within our sales cyclesLeave Commercial DNA behind in every sales engagementRecognised as a commercial subject matter expert not just within the Applications business, but across other LoB’s.Engage in Commercial Sales Enablement training around the regionParticipate in the global Commercial Management Community and share thoughts and ideas on best practiceMay require Travel, predominately in the Asia Pacific region.Provide feedback to the global cloud steering committeeMaintain a comprehensive legal understanding of APAC legislation which concerns customers and prospects, moving to the Cloud.
 In addition, the role encompasses Business Practice responsibilities as follows: Determines and/or implements Corporate/local pricing policy.Assist with reviewing and approving transactions. Monitor incoming transactions.Provide support to the Cloud Tech LOB on transactions.Ensure approval requests are timely, complete and accurate.Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others.Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization.
 Experience and SkillsEducated to degree level.At least 12+ years’ experience in a vendorExperience with Tech Cloud – IaaS & PaaS application is desirable.Experience in leading commercial engagements and negotiations is requiredDeep domain knowledge of commercial/business practice in IT Procurement.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent negotiation skills are requiredStrong presentation skillsTeam player with strong interpersonal skillsProactive self-starterThe credibility and experience to engage successfully with major customer Procurement, Legal, executives, customer’s IT and security teams.Someone who enjoys the challenge of “the unexpected”Someone who can rapidly sort out “fact from fiction” in any situation  Department : Corporate Development OperationsLocation : Singapore / Kuala Lumpur / Sydney / Melbourne / Hong KongJob Type : Regular Employee HireOrganization : Oracle

job_desc:
As a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders daily to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.

 This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  Minimum Bachelor's degree or equivalent  10 or more years of relevant development experience on medium to large scale software projects  Advanced Knowledge of application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines  Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvement  Strong knowledge of Scrum theory, rules and practices/ceremonies.  Strong on Agile techniques like: User Stories, Continuous Integration, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games.  Must have following technical skills : Strong in Java, Spring Framework  Strong in UI Technologies - HTML, JavaScript  Knowledge of React JS, Typescript or Angular (latest version).  Knowledge of Test Driven Development (TDD), exposure to Cucumber.  Understanding of Testing frameworks (JUnit and mocking techniques)  Exposure to Selenium (or similar tool) for Automatic UI testing.  Hands on exposure on services provided by AWS.  Development tools such IntelliJ IDEA, Maven, Bitbucket/Git.  Exposure to Microservice architecture and cloud computing.  Must have following soft skills : Excellent written & verbal communication skills.  Must work well in a supportive and transparent team environment, while having the ability to research, learn and resolve issues independently.  Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals  Proactively identify and communicate issues.  Ability to work effectively with teams having diverse work cultures & skill sets. 
Additional Preferred Skills
 Exposure to orchestration (Kubernetes).  Exposure to compliance functions (AML or Fraud Investigation is a plus)  Experience working with onshore/offshore teams  Exposure to RDMS (Oracle SQL).  Exposure to Kafka, User Analytics (using ELK or similar)

job_title: Technology Consulting, Enterprise Applications & Cloud (SAP Ariba), Manager
job_desc:
We believe that challenges are better solved together. That's why you'll join a diverse, global community of solvers - an unexpected mix of people that come together to build trust in society and solve important problems. With us, you are encouraged to lead with your heart and values, and where your unique skills are developed and put to work in unexpected and exciting ways, superpowered by technology.At PwC South East Asia Consulting, we help businesses to work smarter and grow faster. We partner with our clients to build effective organisations, innovate and grow, reduce costs, manage risk and regulation and, leverage talent. Our aim is to support businesses in designing, managing and executing lasting beneficial change.PwC’s South East Asia Consulting practice provides a comprehensive range of professional services and experience to deliver large scale, cross territory transformation projects, wherever our clients need us to be – from strategy through to execution.
To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.
About the Team
PwC SEAC’s Technology Consulting’s vision is to create meaningful relationships with our clients by powering the next generation digital enterprise.The Enterprise Applications & Cloud team works with our clients to build a legacy of improvement and performance, working with leading enterprise applications including those in the cloud.Our focus areas are SAP, Salesforce, Workday, Oracle, Microsoft and SuccessFactors.

About the Role
Involvement in business process improvement and ERP enablement initiativesConduct business needs analysis and identify key business challenges choices based on knowledge of Ariba capabilities and constraintsIdentify improvement opportunities to achieve clients’ desired business outcomes and engage clients in workshops and interviews to analyse process and reporting requirementsAdvise clients on industry/cross-industry leading practices and on SAP recommended processes and functionsDesign target state SAP solutions for clients and influence clients’ thinking in adopting leading/standard practices while developing target stateAnalyse application landscape to design interfaces to SAP solution Perform SAP configuration and tests and develop specifications for development of forms/report/interfaces Define ‘To-Be’ stage of processes, procedures, organisations, capabilities, solution application requirement and performance measurementsDevelop deployment/enablement strategy, roadmap and plan to achieve ‘To-Be’ stage effectivelyManage/conduct deployment activities and measure achievement of desired outcomes

About you 
A recognised degree qualificationMinimum 5 - 8 years and above of relevant experience, preferably in a professional services firmStrong understanding of how business processes work and integrate in an ERP environmentMinimum 3 years of experience in in area of Ariba Sourcing, SIPM and Contracts space with minimum one implementation where upstream and downstream Ariba solutions were involved/in scope; completed at least 3 end to end full life cycle of SAP Ariba Sourcing, SIPM and Contracts implementationsAbility to design and drive changes for business process reengineering and organisational changeGood understanding of SAP ERP functionalities in Supply Chain Management (Procurement/Sales/Manufacturing)Business experience in large organisation, in procurement and sourcing, in vendor and contracts managementMust have knowledge of Ariba Contracts, Ariba SIPM and Ariba P2PMust have Ariba configuration, enhancement and customization experienceMust have experience with integrating Ariba solutions with SAP and non-SAP applicationsDemonstrated success in multicultural work environmentSound understanding of business process, industry nuances and leading practices in area of focusAbility to facilitate effective workshops to lead target state designBroad understanding of SAP design with appreciation of Digital Enterprise and Emerging TechnologiesStrong written and verbal skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong client service mindset with good project management skills Flexibility to travel in the region when required

job_desc:
Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.

<span data-ccp-props="{"335551550":6,"335551620":6}"> 

The Global Partner Solutions (GPS) team mission is to: build and sell intelligent cloud and intelligent edge solutions with partners, empowering people and organizations to achieve more. GPS is a sales organization accountable for the commercial partner business at Microsoft. 

<span data-ccp-props="{"335551550":6,"335551620":6}"> 

<span data-ccp-props="{"335551550":6,"335551620":6}">With an increased focus on ISVs, we are hiring for a Partner Technology Strategist <span data-ccp-props="{"335551550":6,"335551620":6}">to lead the strategy & engagement with our priority ISV Partners & with the larger partner ecosystem. 

 

The Partner Technology Strategist (PTS) is at the forefront of our digital transformation efforts for our partners. The PTS plays a critical role in working with partners to align their technology roadmaps with Microsoft's technology priorities, working with them to build new solutions that enable customers to realize the vision of Digital Transformation. The PTS is a Credible Technical Advisor to Partners C-Suite technical and practice management executives sharing a compelling technical vision leading to Partners committing to building new practices based on Microsoft’s technologies.

 

Partner Technology Strategist (ISV)


Key areas of responsibility - WHAT PTS’ do:

Partner & Industry Insights. Synthesizes and combines various business insights to conduct forecasting and develop recommendations. Understands market trends, market opportunities, compliance by reading, attending webinars, conferences delivered by Industry thought leaders such as Gartner, Forrester, IDC. Trusted Advisor. Acts as the voice of the partner and internal advocate, joining the Strategic Technology Advisory/Planning groups of partners and contributing with insights that influence the technology roadmaps and investments towards Microsoft.Strategy Formulation. Provides analysis of overall partner needs in alignment towards Microsoft’s technology priorities, and advises on gaps that would benefit from Microsoft solutions as part of Industry solution mapping and capacity planning, ensures execution of technology strategy and digital transformation, and creates mid-term and long-term technical and business roadmaps. Demand Generation & Orchestration. Orchestrates internal teams to ensure sufficient technical resources for future demands. Leads cross-technology team orchestration through the first mile, first few deals, to ensure partners are ready.Differentiated Value Proposition. Partners with a line-of-business leader or senior executive within partner organization to articulate the value of Microsoft technology/services to meet future business needs, and creates and maintains a vision with business and technology solution scenarios and services.Education & Thought Leadership. Uses existing and new readiness resources and demonstrates expertise in creating enablement plans for partners, and provides expertise and is sought out by the Microsoft community at the global level. Envisions the important interdependencies of 3rd party solutions, services and equipment, as well as Partner-to-Partner (P2P) motions for better together strategies among different partners and partner types.Ensuring Succes. Orchestrates a wide, complex range of components for projects/programs within large, partner accounts, and partners with line-of-business leaders or senior executives within the partner organization. Solution/Offer/Practice Development. Proactively influences partners to develop strategic solution using Microsoft technologies. Champions an existing or articulates new architecture approachs, synthesizes data about partner business, applies broad technical, industry, and enterprise knowledge, anticipates technical blockers and adapts methodology to minimize risks for partner solutions / offers and practices. Leads execution of architectural engagements, such as Technical Briefings, Proof of Concepts, Architectural Design Sessions, and Hackathons with the goal of defining and bringing new solutions, offers and/or practices to market. Oversees the successful development and landing of solutions for customer engagements. Partner Enablement. Helps partners build practices or solutions and engages Technical Architects, Industry specialists and Engineering teams for the delivery of workshops, Bootcamps, and trainings necessary to build the technical skills and expertise of partners and influence through solution-sales guidance. 

Experience / Capabilities

8-10+ years of success in consultative, technology solutions development, architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applicationsPartner & Industry Insights. Deep understanding of digital transformation business drivers, cloud platforms, emerging Cloud trends and their impact on customer opportunities. Trusted Advisor. Proven track record of building deep technical relationships with CXOs and building cloud consumption share in Hosters or Managed services providers.Strategy Formulation. Strong understanding of business strategies and outcomes that technology can support, ability to lead the adoption of technologies by plotting the strategic, long-term vision of partners, can anticipate the resolution of technical blockers that arise during strategy planning, and drives envisioning in the roadmaps around new and groundbreaking capabilities.Differentiated Value Proposition. Skilled in helping large-scale, high-stakes partners meet their business goals, achieve their long-term corporate vision, and maximize commercial success. Strong Technical knowledge on one or more of the Microsoft Cloud Platforms and ability to articulate the value proposition of Microsoft Cloud services to partners.Education & Thought Leadership. Ability to drive innovations to help partners meet capacity and capability goals, maximize reach and impact and drive long-term engagement and thought leadership, and influences large partners to see and adopt the strategic value.Ensuring Success. Experience in building new practices and solution offerings on a public cloud and value realization across a variety of solution areas; Ability to set timelines and milestones, and track progress toward objectives, as well as demonstrate technical sales leadership skills to inspire and accelerate partner influenced revenue. Solution Development. Track record of strong solution development skills with a problem-solving mentality, leveraging internal and/or external resources; Ability to build solutions into the partner ecosystem to enable partners to sell to end-customers.Partner Enablement. Experience in offering guidance to the broader technical team to ensure that technical pre-sales, deployment, and consumption are part of solution development efforts; ability to coach the partner on building resilience on technical issues, as well as anticipating and addressing technical competition related challenges.Relationship Building. Proven track record of building deep sales relationships with CXOs and practice building executives in highly strategic partner types.Collaboration and Communication. Acknowledged for driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow through with exceptional verbal and written communication skills; Ability to orchestrate, lead, and influence virtual teams; Strong presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences at different levels of organizations. 3-5+ years experience in the following areas.Cloud application development solutions (e.g. PaaS, Serverless, API Management);Cloud application design; (design/development/deployment, Agile, SCRUM, ALM);Continuous integration technologies (e.g. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure for DevOps, Chef, Puppet);Experience using integrated development environments (e.g. Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, Eclipse, XCode, WebSphere) One or more of the following programming languages: C++, C#, Java, Node.js, JSON, PHP, Perl, Python, Ruby on Rails, Pig/Hive;Migration Techniques, Resiliency2+ years experience in one or more of the following areas. Azure InfrastructureCompute, Networking, Storage, Management Tools, etc.Azure Data & AIAnalytics (e.g. SQL DW, AS, Power BI, Azure Data Factory, etc.)Data Platform (e.g. RDBMS: A-SQL, SQL MI, RDBMS OSS: mySQL, Postgres, noSQL: CDB, Mongo, Cassandra, etc.);Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (e.g. Azure ML, Azure Search and Knowledge Mining, Azure Cognitive Services and Bots, etc.)Business ApplicationsPowerApps + Dynamics 365 DevelopmentFunctional or technical design of Business Applications implementations; Implementing cloud-based (SaaS) Business Applications solutions for either Customer Relationship or Enterprise Resource Planning areasTeamsTeams Platform DevelopmentEducation

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or related field experience preferredCertification in one of the following technologies: Cloud, mobile, web application development, cloud-native application architecture (i.e. containers, microservices, API management), modern software development techniques like DevOps and CI/CD tool chains (i.e. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure developer services, GitHub) and container orchestration systems (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry, Azure Kubernetes Service, GitHub). 

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. 

 

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Do you want to work with data and analytics in the biggest sovereign wealth fund in the world? Do you want to join a team that sits at the heart of the fund's core processes and pioneers the use of cloud technology and analytics to find the most efficient way of supporting our investments? Then we have the job for you!

The Role

As the successful applicant you will be part of the team that operates and develops the fund's data processes and ensures the whole organisation has good quality data available for investment, trading, compliance, and risk management purposes. To find and implement new investment opportunities, the fund is always on the lookout for new data, and you will work closely with internal teams and data vendors to implement new data requirements. As a team they are continuously improving their data processes and controls and look forward to your contribution to this work through applied information technology.

Norges Bank Investment Management has a performance culture, and they believe in delegation. You will be given the opportunity to excel and to make an impact. They would like you to grow into this role and develop with the team.

The position is in Singapore and will report to the Head of Data Core. Some travel should be expected.

What You Will Do

This is a collaborative environment conducive to working on some of the following tasks:
Develop, support, and manage data loads into and between the fund's main systemsEnsure we as a team operate with sound data quality processes and that the fund's functions have good quality data available every dayFurther develop the fund's data warehouse and other data and analytics solutionsFollow-up external data providers to ensure best-market practice and efficient processesContributing to the development of internal tools and models using the latest available technology including cloud-based servicesImplement automation and identify process improvements for the team and across the organisation
What You Need
Minimum Bachelor's degree with excellent academic recordsExperience from the financial industry would be good to have but not a requirementPassion and interest in data science and analyticsDevelopment skills including SQL, data analytics and cloud computing tools
Who You Are
International curious mindset with an eagerness to learn and ambition to excelAnalytical and creative with attention to detailsProactive and self-driven work style and a good team player
What Our Client Offers

Their core values of excellence, innovation, integrity, and team spirit underpin their culture and how they operate across all their offices. They collaborate and share information within the organisation which consists of 37 nationalities. Their organisation is grounded in trust, high ethical standards, a flat hierarchy, and diversity. Norges Bank Investment Management is committed to ensuring Equal Opportunities for all employees.

Benefits Include
Staying healthy - They care about your health! That's why they offer excellent health, mental and dental benefits, including a comprehensive insurance for you and your family. You'll also be offered health assessments, counselling services and reimbursement of gym membership fees.Spending time with family - Becoming a parent? Don't stress! You'll get 16 weeks, gender-neutral, full base pay, parental leave to spend with your child. Mothers get an additional 10 weeks of pregnancy related leave.Recharge when you need to - All employees get 25 vacation days, and one extra for the last week of the yearWork-life balance - Our client believes that a healthy balance is crucial for your well-being. When you work here, you'll be able to combine an exciting career in the world's largest sovereign wealth fund with a fulfilling life outside the office. Of course, there are several social clubs and events within the fund too if you'd like to combine the two!Planning for the long term - They contribute 17% or 20% of base salary to your CPF or SRS. You can focus on the present and don't worry about the future.Work with Purpose - Our client work to safeguard and build financial wealth for future generations. Through responsible investment and active ownership, we help shape the future of our world.
Interested candidates may send in their resume and cover letter directly to gem.cabria@manpower.com.sg (R1434374), stating the position as the subject title in the email.

Jireli Gem Mejia Cabria EA License No.: 02C3423 Personnel Registration No.: R1434374

Please note that your response to this advertisement and communications with us pursuant to this advertisement will constitute informed consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of personal data by ManpowerGroup Singapore for the purpose of carrying out its business, in compliance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Data Protection Act 2012. To learn more about ManpowerGroup's Global Privacy Policy, please visit https://www.manpower.com.sg/privacy-policy

AlphaLab Capital is a leading provider of technology for quantitative trading. Each day, our infrastructure and algorithms enable traders to supply billions of dollars of liquidity to major exchanges around the globe. We are looking for a senior data engineer to play a pivotal role in how we digest, store, and process market and internal business data. You will work closely with our co-founders to leverage data to drive and improve our trading and business decisions.
As the lead data engineer, you will be responsible for developing a data platform that allows our teams to create operational data pipelines, conduct ad hoc data exploration, and serve structured data to end users. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand the market and business processes that generate the data, the frequency and latency with which these need to be ingested, and the transformations that need to be applied. You will also be responsible for providing infrastructure that makes our vast amounts of data accessible and efficient to query so our teams know what information is available and can make the best data-driven decisions. You are a self-starter and are comfortable working cross-functionally with other teams.
Summary of key responsibilities
Work closely with the trading, engineering, and business teams to understand external and our internal sources of data and translate this understanding into business requirements for the data platformTurn these requirements into technical design for scalable data pipelines/ETL processes using modern tools and best practices (including selection of said tools), leveraging existing infrastructure as appropriateDesign and develop efficient data storage and query infrastructure to support internal analytics and trade optimization needsBuild support for metadata in the data platform in order to expose data lineage, a data dictionary, and other appropriate documentationEnsure data ingested into pipelines are of high quality and processes are in place to detect and address any changes in or issues arising from third party sources and/or upstream operational tablesDesign business intelligence infrastructure and interfaces to improve availability and usability of data and insights, including selection and maintenance of tooling (e.g., AuroraDB, Grafana, etc.)Work with company leadership and business teams to review utilization of data and plan for future needsPartner with and clearly communicate results to influence leaders and key decision-makers
Ideal qualifications
At least 7 years of experience in data engineering with a focus on building data pipelines and platform infrastructureDegree in engineering or a related technical field with an interest in the digital asset spaceStrong knowledge of SQL and PythonAdvanced knowledge of data warehousing concepts and schema optimization based on usage patterns in a data-heavy environmentExperience in developing ETL processes, managing scheduling, and implementing data quality checksPrior experience with creating data storage and query infrastructure as well as business intelligence tooling for data producers and consumersHands-on experience with cloud-based data infrastructure and warehousing solutions, preferably in AWS and/or GCPExperience with Airflow, dbt, or other similar data tooling is a plusAbility to work cross-functionally, build trust with internal stakeholders, derive business requirements, and translate these into technical specificationsExcellent communication skills with strong market intuition and ability to understand complex business systems, versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job

job_desc:
Assurity Trusted Solutions (ATS) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Government Technology Agency (GovTech), incorporated to operate the National Authentication Framework (NAF) and National Certification Authority (NCA). We aim to be the Source of Trust in the use of digital services, and committed to enhance Trust and High Assurance of digital services by providing secure and convenient identity management solutions.
Are you ready to be part of the only National Certification Authority (NCA) in Singapore which provides high assurance solutions that enable consumers and businesses to enjoy more seamless and safe digital transactions in their everyday lives?
We are looking for a Cloud Security Specialist to join us in our mission to enhance Singapore’s competitiveness as a trusted ICT hub for citizens and businesses, and to expand our product offerings into new regional markets.
A brief summary of your job responsibility:Formulate and enforce IT security framework and management processes which includes security policies, procedures, standards and guidelines.Provide consultation support on Privileged Management, End-pint protection technologies, vulnerability scanning solutions, Commercial Cloud-native security tools and Zero-Trust network toolsCreate and maintain up to date incident response playbooks. Perform incident response actions in response to security incidents.Perform IT security assessments (such as security risk assessment, system technical controls review etc).Assess and review existing processes/baselines and security measures to ensure they are working effectively.Review and enhance controls against possible lessons from external incidents and emerging cyber risks. To succeed in this role, you will ideally have:Bachelor Degree / Diploma holder in IT / information security or equivalent.5 or more years of experience in IT, of which 3 years in information security.Candidate with a strong application, infrastructure, commercial cloud or zero-trust network experience are welcome to apply.Knowledge and understanding of public key infrastructure, cloud technologies, cybersecurity, risk management, security framework and methodologies for controls, compliance and auditing such as NIST, ISO 27001, Center for Internet Security (CIS) Benchmark.Independent and able to perform tasks with minimum supervision.Highly analytical, process-oriented, collaborative and creative individual.Candidate with professional certifications such as CEH, CISSP, CISA or CCSP will be an advantage.
Join us and discover a meaningful and exciting career with Assurity Trusted Solutions!

Possess university degree(s) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Electrical, Electronic, or other IT-related subjects; 3+ years as an Enterprise Security Architect / Consultant; With hands on experience in designing cloud frameworks or implementing cloud security;Experience in large scale enterprise Cloud projects from ideation to finished production product;2 years or more of hands-on experience migrating customers to the cloud and designing DevOps operational processes, deployment checklists, etc;Experience and understanding of Infrastructure as Code, Automation, and Orchestration;Experience deploying web and service-based applications in Windows/Linux environments;Related Cloud Security certifications (AWS/GCP/Azure);Related professional certifications preferred (CISSP, CISA, CEH, CCSP, GIAC, SABSA, etc.);Knowledge and experience across IT infrastructure with security frameworks and standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, and other relevant security-related regulations;Possess knowledge and understanding of risks and its impact to the business and have the ability to articulate the need and value of security solutions to an organization;Strong analytical, creative problem-solving and negotiation skills, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment;Good program or project management skills and have the ability to navigate complex stakeholder relationships;Excellent written and oral communication skills, including both technical and business writing, documentation and presentation skills, with the ability to present ideas and results to technical and non-technical audiences;Minimum 5 - 8 years of relevant experience in Cybersecurity and Cloud Security;Strong preference for basic competency in two or more of the following:Cloud security strategy, risk, and privacy management;Experience and certification in Cloud Security, including AWS, Azure, or GCPSecurity architecture, design, and blueprint, including working experience in Akamai, FireEye, Palo Alto Networks, Splunk, Tanium, CrowdStrike, Titus, Thales, Digital Guardian, Symantec, Airwatch, AWS, Azure, SafeNet, Gemalto, etc.Data and application protection, including data classification, data discovery, data governance, DLP, IRM, EDR, tokenization, encryption, blockchain, TDE, cloud, mobility, microservices, APIsec, devsecops, API, back-up/recovery and retention, etc.;Cyber security, including, MS Azure Security, AWS Security, TVM, APT, IPS, SIEM, DDoS, defacement, SOC operations/automation and testing, metrics, monitoring and reporting, etc.;Strong time management skills, self-directed, with the ability to work both independently and part of a diverse team;

job_title: Cloud and IT Transformation - Cloud Strategy Manager
job_desc:
We believe that challenges are better solved together. That's why you'll join a diverse, global community of solvers - an unexpected mix of people that come together to build trust in society and solve important problems. With us, you are encouraged to lead with your heart and values, and where your unique skills are developed and put to work in unexpected and exciting ways, superpowered by technology.
A career in our Cloud and Network Architecture practice, within Cloud Computing and Networking services, will provide you with the opportunity to focus on the joint business relationship between PwC and Google, HP, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, and other cloud based platforms that bring new and innovative services to some of the largest companies. We help our clients adopt the cloud to transform Information Technology, scale and streamline operations and create new cloud based businesses through our strong alliances. You’ll be at the forefront of helping organisations around the globe adopt innovative technology solutions that optimise business processes or enable scalable technology.
Our team helps organisations transform their network architecture and infrastructure to fundamentally change the role of Information Technology from an custodial asset to an orchestrator of business services. As part of the team, you’ll focus on the architecture of data centres, including the design and implementation of network architecture and information storage to optimise innovation and programme delivery for our clients.
To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.
As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:
Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.

One of our clients in Singapore who is an Australian-born technology company is looking for a Cloud Operations Engineer who are skilled with the following requirements below.
Core Skills:Strong understanding of core AWS cloud technologies such as :Managing and optimizing ECS clusters; including optimizing auto-scaling to cater for extreme swings in demandEC2, NetworkingCloud-watch, LambdaSuperb analytical and troubleshooting skills in order to perform root-cause analysis on issues raised and action plans to address the incident as well as the problem.Cloudformation, Jenkins, Ansible and Bitbucket
Soft Skills:Candidate will work directly with highly technical users to understand issues and perform root-cause analysis – note this is not end-user support, but down-stream engineers and developers using the services and applicationsAble to interface effectively with stakedholders with different levels of technology background, from pure business, super-users, developers, and other engineers.Able to interface with other engineering teams with varying levels of cloud knowledge to explain root causes and recommend / roll-out remediation for cloud services.Appetite to learn
We are looking to appoint a Cloud Engineer to support our client's IT Support team as they transition to the AWS and roll-out their applications on AWS.
What this team does:They’re part of the SPE team which manages 6 different trading applications in AWS. We operate by weekly standup usually on Thursday with the application stakeholder to understand the progress of the assigned tasks in JIRA. Day to Day we need to respond to any last min request from the application team such as rebuilding cluster in AWS, change parameter in bitbucket and redeploy, standardize design throughout all 6 applications, respond to production issues and provide RCA to app stakeholders.Apart from that, within JIRA we do have backlogs to clear such as exploring new features or administrative stuff such as changing instancetypes.When production system acts “abnormal” we need to provide infra level analysis and understand where the issue is, where it went wrong and why it went wrong.

MOM (Singapore) EA Licence No: 18S9504

JMS offers a single pane of glass to manage Java deployments across the enterprise. job_title: Intern, Developer Relations Software Engineer – Identity (DPE-SPG-Engineering)
job_desc:
Job Requisition ID #

22WD56575

Position Overview

Autodesk Identity service provides a secure, available and scalable user authentication and service to service API authorization capability for all of Autodesk Products and Cloud Services. The team is focused on building the next gen platform for the Customer Identity and Access Management Solutions.

Responsibilities

As a Developer Relations Engineer (DevRel Intern), you will write code that other developers use as a reference. You will create and deliver content to help them learn and use Autodesk's Identity service APIs. Also, you will answer the developer queries on various forums. On this highly cross-functional team, you will work with partners in Engineering, Product management, and other customer-facing teams. While much of the team output is content and responding to developer queries, engineering is at the heart of everything we do. To teach developers how to use these technologies, we first must understand them deeply ourselves. You may be the first developer to build something with a new API. Additionally, you will help to develop/maintain tools that are frequently used by DevRel team.

Minimum Qualifications

Undergraduate in Computer Engineering

Preferred Qualifications
 Excellent communication and problem-solving skills  Experience with cloud services such as AWS, Google Cloud, Azure etc would be given preference  Passion for helping developers  Comfortable working with a broad range of tools 
Learning Benefits

The intern will learn the practices employed by a Developer Relations Engineer or a Developer Advocates. You will be responsible for promoting the adoption of Autodesk' Identity API services, as well as help other developers to have a delightful onboarding experience.

About Autodesk

With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity.

Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers, and architects to digital artists, students, and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
