job_title: Senior Infrastructure Engineer, Mail and Collaboration Services
job_desc:
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Government Infrastructure Group (GIG)

The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore

How We Work

Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards and best practices to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure.

We examine factors such as people, culture, policies and processes to provide a secure, predictive and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime.

By leveraging on innovative Cloud and SaaS technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacenter hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services.

Transforming ICT infrastructure through modernization and automation is also our key focus. Using latest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly.

We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy and training.

Job Overview

As a Senior Infrastructure Engineer, you will be part of team to implement and manage the Whole-of-Government (WOG) Infrastructure and services. You will work within a team of engineers with strong technical competency to conceptualise, implement and manage the Government infrastructure services and ensuring high levels of availability, performance and security across the Whole-of-Government (WOG).

You will also collaborate with peers from other disciplines such as software developers, data engineers, UX Designers and Product Managers to design, develop and implement infrastructure products for WOG.

 What you will be working on: 
Lead and work with outsourced service providers and product principals to manage the delivery, operations as well as Tech Refresh for Microsoft Office 365 suite of services:Microsoft Exchange Online;Microsoft Azure AD and Intune;Skype, MS Teams and SharePoint Online;Enterprise Documents and Records Management System; andOffice 365.Work closely with the infrastructure architects to rationalise the technical design and ensure the solution works well with Government infrastructure, policies, standards and security requirements.Translate the technical solution/design into technical specifications and functional requirements.Work with infrastructure architects to rationalise the technical design and ensure the solution works well with Government infrastructure, policies, standards and security requirements.Translate solution designs to technical specifications for tender.Ensure the operations process and controls are clearly documented and operationalisedExplore new solutions and technologies, integrate learning and recommendations for operational efficiency and continual improve of the infrastructure for better user experience.Plan, design and support Technology Refresh and migration activities for the infrastructure services.Ensure smooth service delivery and implementation within the business context.

 What we are looking for: 
At least 5 years of experience in the above domain areasProven planning, implementation and migration experience from Exchange on-premise to Microsoft Exchange OnlineTeam player with strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.Knowledge in SCRUM or DevOps.Knowledge of ITIL processes and procedures.PowerShell scripting is a bonus.Possess the following soft skills and attributes:Ability to justify new initiatives and recommend new initiatives to stakeholder(s)Conceptualise the concept of operation for the new initiativesFamiliar with tendering process, defining requirements in tender specificationTeam player by leading discussion between internal teams (Operations, Security, Contract) and external product principals or system integratorRequires minimal supervision from supervisorAlways keeping up to date of the latest product roadmap and best practicesDefine policies and procedures related to Endpoint Management.Good written and verbal communication, with the ability to present and communicate effectively with non-technical audience.Provide inputs to optimise and automate workflows and processesAble to work independently and as a good team player with analytical, management and planning skillsDynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills.

Preferred Certification/Skills
Certification in Networking and Azure fundamentalsCertification in ITIL foundation

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.
Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. 
Responsibilities- Support the Sales Teams to Qualify leads, Identify Customers' Pain Points and Translate Technologies into Solutions that meet Customers' Business Goals. - Call upon Technical Expertise and Sales Acumen to lead the Qualification process through Demos, Presentations, Architecture Design Sessions & Technical Workshops.- Lead RFPs/RFIs/Hands-on POCs by owning the overall process, and ensuring an optimum collaboration across all stakeholders. Convert POCs into Contracts. - Become a Trusted Advisor Internally and Externally by providing Thought Leadership, Industry Knowledge, and deep understanding across all Technologies that Bytedance B2B is providing.- Collaborate with all stakeholders including Solution Team, Product Team, Strategy, and R&D, to help influence product roadmap based on Market Feedback in your region.- Build or improve Tools and Processes to help scale highly customized Technical POCs.- Present to C-Suite, Business and Technical stakeholders to help raise brand awareness of Bytedance B2B across APAC. Articulate Business and Technical value. - Upsell, cross-sell and drive adoption of Bytedance solutions for existing customers.
Qualifications- Engineering Bachelor degree and above; - At least 1 - 3 years of related work experience, preferably AI-related or IT consultant solution & pre-sale role;- Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, deep understanding of the AI technologies as well as Industry vertical pain points- Hands-On experience on the following technologies :  - Video/Image processing (OpenGL/C) - Web and App Software development (JS, ios, Android) - Databases, Analytics, AI.- Experience in reading/writing programming languages (Server, Web, Android/iOS Mobile App), Deep Understanding of Software development technologies, Can manage debugging and troubleshooting, Comfortable with APIs;- Knowledge in Cloud Infrastructures, Security and Compliance is a plus.- Experience in Project Management;- Data-Driven Pragmatism, critical thinking and outcome-driven;- Comfortable with fast-paced and ambiguous "startup" environment

FWD Group spans Hong Kong & Macau, Thailand, Indonesia, the Philippines, Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, and Japan, offering life and medical insurance, general insurance and employee benefits across a number of its markets.

FWD is focused on creating fresh customer experiences, with easy-to-understand products, supported by digital technology. Through this customer-led approach, FWD aims to become a leading pan-Asian insurer that changes the way people feel about insurance.

Established in Asia in 2013, FWD is the insurance business of investment group, Pacific Century Group. For more information please visit WWW.FWD.COM

PURPOSE

Work on the organisation-wide initiative to design and develop data governance policies, procedures and data management practices;Independently work with country for implementation and execution on data governance with framework (Data Quality, Catalogue, Lineage and Metadata Management, etc.), procedures, data quality, data rules and policies, data standards and data governance detail plans;

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

Work on the data governance awareness and culture activities by collaborating with Compliance, Risk and IT cyber security team with respect to data governance requirements (including. personal data impact assessment, storage and retention requirements, incident reporting) that are specified in new and emerging regulations;Identify and define key risk indicators for data risks, including defining data assessment approachDevelop and maintain Data Strategy and Governance documentation within FWD internal sites for organisation-wide disseminationDevelop policies, controls and processes for access controls, data quality, data security and data privacy, etc.;Develop training materials and conduct training with stakeholders (Data Owners, Stewards, Engineering team and Data Scientist team, etc.) to guide data governance effortsCollaborate with Data Science team to co-develop Responsible AI policies and proceduresMonitor and provide support to all Master Data and work with stakeholders for Master Data Management initiatives to ensure data quality and compliant with company standardsDevelop metrics to assess and measure the success of data governance & performance;Develop business rules and policy across organisation Critical Data Elements and documentation of the results;Execute and collaborate with staff at Group/BU on data projects

QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's or higher in Business, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, MIS, Data Science, Statistics or others similar field is preferred, but not mandatory;7-8 years of experience in data stewardship, data management, data analytics, or related data field to proven experience in Data and AI Governance;At least 5 years in data governance and data strategy consultancy and implementation experienceExperience in Data Strategy, Data Scientist, Data Governance initiatives including but not limited to Master Data Management and possible technology issues;

KNOWLEDGE & TECHNICAL SKILLS

Knowledge of industry leading data quality, reference data management and data protection management practices.Knowledge of data governance practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets and approaches related to data protection.Knowledge of data related government regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues in the countries where FWD has presence and operations.Demonstrated consulting skills, with change management concepts and strategies, including communication, culture change and performance measurement system design.Knowledge in data management with cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, Azure or GCP);Knowledge of insurance industry leading data analytics and AI practices;Extensive knowledge of data governance tool implementation (e.g. Informatica, Infosphere, Colibra, etc.);Demonstrated past success in translating ambiguous or complex requirements into contents that are readily understandable by non-IT professionals;Experience with large scale data programs or solutions;Experience in SQL and data modelling or experience in any NoSQL solution is a plus;Extensive experience in Project Management is a plus;Fluency in English, Cantonese and Mandarin (written & verbal)

Do What You Love. Love What You Do.

At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.

About The Team

This Workmate plays a pivotal role in guiding Workday’s international product strategies as we grow to become a $10B company. This role is responsible for driving both geographic expansion and international product strategy for Workday’s key markets and industries. You and the Globalisation team will develop and present business cases for international market expansion as well as global product and solution strategies in existing geographic markets. Further, you will work closely with regional leadership and product experts across the organisation to ensure these strategies are appropriately included in product plans across the Workday portfolio.

About The Role
Design and develop strategies to align and expand Workday’s industry-leading product portfolio to new markets and market-segments within the APJ region.Drive the APJ product strategy function responsible for performing market, competitive, and product-market fit analyses, and formulating, codifying, and ensuring operationalisation of our globalisation platform and global product strategies across Workday’s product portfolio.Partner with internal cross-functional teams including Sales, Pre-Sales, Services, Localisation, Product Strategists, Product Management, and Technology to gather, document, and champion country- and region-specific market and feature requirements.Identify, assess, and quantify industry market and geographic expansion opportunities, appropriately prioritise, and develop business cases for selected strategies.Together with product strategists and architects, be responsible for identifying, devising and communicating a comprehensive strategy for product globalisation in your region.Partner with product managers and strategists to report project and program statuses to key stakeholders in your region.Identify and drive continuous improvement initiatives to ensure Workday’s globalisation processes are best-in-class.You will work closely with peers and stakeholders across the APJ region and some travel will be necessary. 

About YouBasic Qualifications7+ years’ experience in the area(s) of corporate strategy, product management, solutions delivery, client services, or non-technical program management including 5+ years’ developing and executing programs with significant corporate impact and 2+ years’ experience gathering and documenting product requirements.Other QualificationsDeep understanding of consulting frameworks and methodologies especially in the areas of go-to-market strategy, product market fit assessment, or requirements gathering/MVP definition.Bachelor’s degree in a business-related subject area, MBA/advanced degree preferred.Results-driven leader who can individually drive projects requiring collaborative inputs. This role will require the successful candidate to closely interact with internal partners across all areas of the business and synthesise their needs into actionable projects.Excellent English-language written and verbal communication skills.Strong analytical abilities, including experience with market analysis, forecasting, expansion planning, strategy execution, and business case development.Able to influence others using data and other evidence-based persuasive tools.Prior experience in ERP software feature localisation is desirable.Prior experience in ERP go-to-market strategy is desirable.Knowledge and understanding of software development methodologies and life cycles is desirable.

Job Description

We are looking for skilled data scientists with a background in statistical modeling and in taking algorithms through to production. The role will require interaction with clients and collaboration with Protos Labs’ founders and our passionate team of data scientists and software engineers, shaping data analytics solutions to meet client needs.

Role Responsibilities
Improving or developing new algorithms, new risk models and productsIdentifying, implementing, and deploying new statistical and machine learning methods to differentiate Protos Labs from its competitorsParticipating in the development of Protos Labs’ technological platformCollaborating with the business team to understand client needs and issues to further strengthen our technical excellenceIdentifying new and innovative ideas and testing state-of-the-art methods from scratch based on recent research articles
Requirements
3 years’ experience in statistical or cyber risk modellingProficient in statistics, applied mathematics and machine learning methodsProficiency in Python (e.g. scikit-learn, numpy, pandas), R and TableauCurious, likes problem solving and going down rabbit holes to find answers
Preferred Skills
Experience in all portions of the data analytics pipeline, including ingest, cleaning, feature extraction, modelling, statistical validation, and visualization / reportingCompetence in software development practices including writing and verifying maintainable code, version control, cloud-based development, and performance profiling and tuning
What We Do

Protos Labs is building a next-generation cyber risk intelligence platform that helps enterprises and insurers to quantify cyber risk confidently. We combine Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence and Statistical Modelling to help organizations accurately quantify their cyber risk exposure and reduce the likelihood of a breach.

Why Join Us

We are founded by former Booz Allen cybersecurity consultants and backed by prominent VCs in the SEA startup ecosystem. Having worked with some of the highest-performing consulting teams in the past, we believe talent and competency is not a factor of age. We also encourage diversity of thought while placing emphasis on the collective power of a team. We offer competitive salary based on experience and health insurance and benefits.

Main Objectives Of The Role
Lead, design, plan, propose, develop and execute security architectures, policies, procedures, methods and tools to implement automated, fault tolerant and scalable Cloud Infrastructure. Work with Engineering and Product teams to perform risk assessment, identify and recommend timely solutions and to continuously improve integration and the security posture of services. Align business growth with the firm’s strategic vision by developing effective, reliable and reusable architecture solutions that meet immediate and future project requirements.Keep abreast of the latest technology trends to advise, shape, implement and improve security architecture best practices in an evolving environment. Contribute to overall application and infrastructure design.
Core Skills
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field.5+ years relevant experience working with Public Cloud (Azure, Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services).Strong scripting language knowledge (Infrastructure as Code) with Docker and Kubernetes experience.Experience in Cloud Authentication, Access management Services, with exposure to Infrastructure Management tools like Terraform, Ansible.Working knowledge and understanding of networking technologies such as LAN, WAN, TCP/IP, load balancers, firewalls etc. An ability to drive creation of prototypes and proof of concepts. Software development experience with good knowledge of IT security fundamentals.Strong problem solving, critical thinking, analytical, influencing and negotiation skills.  Excellent customer service, written/oral communication and presentation skills.  Team contributor with good interpersonal skills and positive attitude to cope with high pressure work environment.  
Interested?

This is a fantastic opportunity to join the Singapore team of a global firm that takes prides in its customer-centric culture and state-of-the-art Cloud technology. Please register your interest by applying to this exciting career move and getting in touch with either  

Simon +65 8318 4164 simon.ranahan@menrvaconsulting.com OR Steve +65 91097879 steve.menrvaconsulting.com

IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. Your Life @ IBM

 As an Online Backend Engineer you will participate on a team of 4-6 mid-level engineers, under the supervision of the lead engineer.  Full-time, 100% remote  Participate in hands-on software engineering work, and peer review.  Facilitate communication between clients, internal teams/management, and other individual contributors. Experience in scaling services reliably to a huge number of concurrent users.  Polyglot development experience with multiple backend platforms and languages. Great with lateral thinking and motivation to work independently and on a team as well as the ability to work directly with teams across multiple territories and time zones. The ability to handle high pressure situations, with composure and diplomacy.

Experience with cross-platform online gaming is a plus.  Experience implementing an online gaming infrastructure is a plus.  3+ years experience in the games industry. job_title: Product Technical Lead, M365 and Azure
job_desc:
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Government Infrastructure Group (GIG)

The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore

How We Work

Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards and best practices to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure.

We examine factors such as people, culture, policies and processes to provide a secure, predictive and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime.

By leveraging on innovative Cloud and SaaS technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacenter hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services.

Transforming ICT infrastructure through modernization and automation is also our key focus. Using latest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly.

We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy and training.

Job Overview

The Product Technical Lead is responsible to oversee the product infrastructure engineering team and identify and deliver the appropriate technology solutions . You are responsible to lead and provide direction for the technical solution and architecture for the products and ensure the detailed design and development is aligned with the enterprise architecture.

 What you will be working on: 
Lead, drive and manage the overall product conceptualisation to implementation for Whole of Government M365/D365/O365 implementation and operations.Possess Microsoft 365 suite and Azure skillset in the areas of design, implementation and operations. As the subject matter expert in the area of Azure and Microsoft products such asMicrosoft 365 (such as Exchange Online, OneDrive, SharePoint Online, TEAMS)Dynamics 365 including Power BI, Power Automate and Power PlatformMS Enterprise Mobility Suite (inTunes, MCAS, Azure Information Protection)Azure Active Directory (configuring and setting up the synchronisation of on-premise AD with Azure Active Directory, federation service)Other Microsoft products such as Yammer, Stream, Telephony services.Plan the technology roadmap, review technology improvements and feedback for Microsoft suite of products throughout the deployment and operations cycle.Effectively manage the technology roadmap based on our strategic goals, prioritizing across tactical and strategic goals, and align business needs and technical priorities.Work with the team to translate technical solution and design to technical specifications for tender.Understand technical, quality management and security guidelines and policies and ensure development processes and systems comply with these policy and guidelines.Lead the product team and the contractors on the product delivery according to the business requirements.Identify opportunities, develop technical design and solution and ensure the solution work well with the government infrastructure, policies, standards and security requirements.Coordinate with Product Principals and System Integrators on the evaluation of technology solutions, carry out proof-of-concepts to validate and establish the appropriate solution for the business.Manage infrastructure operations and support and ensure delivery of services meet agreed service levels.Develop effective stakeholder relationships across GovTech and with stakeholders from government agencies.Communicate and present to senior stakeholders on project progress and resolve issues efficiently.Partner closely with the development and design team in an agile environment and continually improve ways of working.Identify potential project risks and the implications and to recommend mitigating measures to manage the risks.

 What we are looking for: 
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information/Infocomm Technology, Computer or Electronics Engineering or related discipline.Relevant digital product management experience in a demanding, agile environment with at least 8 years managerial and leadership responsibilities.Proven record of successfully delivering high-impact, complex projects while managing risks.Able to work independently and as a good team player with analytical, management and planning skills.Strong vendor and stakeholder management.Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with a wide array of people at both junior and senior levelsPro-active, dynamic and with good analytical/conceptual thinking and problem-solving skills.Excellent written, verbal communication, presentation and negotiation skills.Agile related certification such as Certified Scrum Master is an added advantage.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round.
Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

job_title: Technology Project Execution, Vice President, Singapore
job_desc:
The Chief Technology Office oversees enabling components inclusive of the top quality engineering and architecture tools and practices, key program management and processes as well as the technology workforce strategy required to make us a leading technology company for our customers, clients and colleagues around the world.

This role requires a wide range of strengths and capabilities, including:
 Collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals to accomplish common goals  Drive project execution, management, and prioritization firm-wide.  Proficiency in one or more business disciplines or functions  Experience project managing multiple projects  Knowledge of global and line of business project management standards and methods  Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals  Plan, monitor, and track on production availability and other metrics  Communicate issues and status updates with all stakeholders effectively  Work with multiple engineering teams to build production support cases in multi-cloud environment 
Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree  10+ years of technical project management experience, especially around software development, DevOps, SRE, etc.  Proven experience with large distributed systems in critical production service environments  Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Project, JIRA, Confluence or other Project Management tool  Strong knowledge in incident management and change management process  Familiarity with log and monitoring tools with best practices  Excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills  PMP and AWS certifications are big plus 
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 15 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry.

At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Medical authorities agree that being vaccinated is the best way to protect yourself, loved ones, colleagues and communities from COVID-19. To protect the health and safety of our employees, and for workforce planning purposes in line with the Ministry of Manpower's guidance, the successful candidate must be either fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (as defined by the Singapore Ministry of Health at the time of commencing employment) or be certified by a medical practitioner as being medically ineligible to be fully vaccinated.

The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.

Job Description

VICA (Virtual Intelligent Citizen Assistant) is GovTech's next-generation Chatbot/Virtual Assistant/Conversation AI platform. It will serve as the platform to enable the tech refresh of all 90+ existing Ask Jamie govt agency chatbots. VICA will also leverage Machine Learning/AI technologies to perform advanced analytics on chatbot content, to improve the citizen experience when interacting with govt agency chatbots.

What You Will Be Working On:
Developing and maintaining all server-side network components.Ensuring optimal performance of the central database and responsiveness to front-end requests.Collaborating with front-end developers on the integration of elements.Designing customer-facing UI and back-end services for various business processes.Developing high-performance applications by writing testable, reusable, and efficient code.Implementing effective security protocols, data protection measures, and storage solutions.Running diagnostic tests, repairing defects, and providing technical support.Documenting Node.js processes, including database schemas, as well as preparing reports.Recommending and implementing improvements to processes and technologies.Keeping informed of advancements in the field of Node.js development.Our technology stack is based on MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js), with Python for our ML component: We use Kubernetes and Docker for CI/CD, REST APIs and Infrastructure running on Cloud (AWS)

 What We Are Looking For: 
 5+ years of relevant experience  Expertise with Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js  Expertise with Golang is a bonus  Expertise in back-end development  Expertise in front-end development with React.js is a bonus  Expertise in architecting scalable and reliable cloud-based software solutions  Working experience with agile teams  Working experience in automated software testing  Working experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon AWS, Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or Microsoft Azure  Working experience developing and integrating with SOAP/REST APIs  Working experience with DevOps and CI/CD  Working experience with Google Dialogflow is a bonus  Working experience with other Chatbots/ML/NLP is a bonus  Works well as part of a team in a fast-paced, startup-like environment  Excellent communication and organizational skills 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is essential to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s meaningful for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round

Introduction

Brand Technical Specialist (BTS) are the technical experts and advisors to clients, IBM sales teams and/or IBM Business Partners. As a BTS you understand the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape. You apply your business insights, build and maintain client relationships, incorporate hardware, software and services into client-valued solutions and ensure client readiness for the implementation of technical solutions. This is an opportunity to shape the future for both IBM and its clients. Start your journey now!

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a Zero Trust Identity & Data Security Solution Architect/Adviser, you are IBM’s technical sales consultant to our clients and a technical sales leader for IBM sales teams. You will learn your client's

business requirements, technical requirements, and competitive landscape and apply your technical knowledge and experience to bring new solutions to your assigned clients. You will be responsible

for collaborating with IBM sales teams to define, design, and detail the technical aspects and feasibility of proposed solutions. You will deliver solution workshops, product demonstrations, technical education, and Proof of Concepts.You will support technical escalations, design solutions, and answer technical questions throughout the sales process in order to progress and close sales and develop customer relationships. You will assist the IBM sales team with quantifying the value proposition of our solutions with clients. The Zero Trust Identity & Data Security Solution Architect/Adviser, has an in-depth understanding of products, offerings, and services within their specialty as well as strong business acumen. Candidates in this role will be responsible for the support of the IBM Security Software Portfolio for your assigned territory.

Key Attributes

 Demonstrated technical and business value aptitude Demonstrated customer-facing, presentation, written communication, and interpersonal skills Ability to work independently in a mobile environment Solution Architect/Adviser skills in Zero Trust Identity & Data Security Taking initiatives to own accounts and issues and driving team members toward the common goal of winning business Ability to articulate the technical benefits of IBM's IT portfolio products, solutions, and services to all levels in customer's organization Ability to identify the client’s business and technical requirements Ability to build and maintain relationships with key decisions makers and influencers at your

clients

 Ability to develop and deliver compelling demonstrations, proof of concepts, prototypes, and other pre-sales assets which tie IBM Security solutions to Customer Value. Ability to assist with Request for Proposal (RFP)/Request for Information (RFI) and other technical questionnaires. Competency in support training and consulting in post-sales tool and processing deployment situations Understanding of Information Management surrounding technology at a high level and positioning value props for these products with clients Ability to provide technical assistance for marketing activities: Regional Workshops, User Group Meetings, Sales Seminars, Meet-ups, and Trade Shows

Required Qualifications - Data Security Domain- Good understanding of public cloud/ hyperscalers

 At least 10 years experience in Information Technologies At least 5 years experience in Software Presales, Sales Engineering Good understanding of at-least one of these domains with hands-on experience : Identity & Access Management Domain CIAM, PAM, Workforce IAM Understanding of SAML, OAuth 2.0, OIDC, Federation, FIDO2, Cloud Security Data Protection (structured, unstructured, semi-structured data), Data Encryption (files/database/containers), Application Encryption/Tokenization, Cloud Key Management, Key Lifecycle Management Excellent communication skills, including writing, speaking, and listening. Excellent presentation skills

Preferred Qualifications

 Bachelor's Degree CISSP or other Security related certification Knowledge in Kubernetes/OpenShift Container Platform Any experience in developing application for web/mobile is an added advantages

job_title: Lead for Cloud Strategic Projects, APAC
job_desc:
Orange Cloud for Business (OCB) is growing strongly in APAC, with a 19% revenue growth in 2021 achieving 70m EUR, and a forecast of 30% growth in 2022 to achieve 91m EUR with an ambition to achieve 100m EUR revenue.
To ensure we reach our goals, OCB has built a strategic plan with five main initiatives and we are seeking a highly motivated Senior project management officer to lead and manage in detail these five main OCB APAC strategic initiatives from our Singapore office, in close proximity to Orange Business Services APAC management.
This role will function as an authority on building and implementing these key initiatives to enable us to win even more deals and develop our partnership ecosystem.You will be responsible for ensuring OCB's 3-year strategic plan roll-out is on track and always in harmony with business priorities.If you want to join a company that values self-motivated, passionate, and fearless individuals who think out of the box, we want you to work for OCB APAC!
Position Objectives Build, implement and manage OCB APAC 3-year strategic plan roll-out and OCB APAC key initiatives in each country.
Essential duties · Collaborate closely with OCB APAC Head to roll out all initiatives in APAC countries· Support on business development by ensuring OCB has the highest visibility and positioning OCB with analysts, business and IT consulting firms, media· Drive with OCB APAC head and each country the focus on MultiCloud, Orange Cloud, CDN, Data & AI, Services· Lead initiatives enhancing OCB portfolio across multiple business units· Build and lead innovation in OCB in APAC: Build value proposition and lead gen for focused solutions· Package service bundles with the Professional Services team and ensure it is communicated appropriately to sales teams· Ensure we build, engage, follow with OBS in general, OCB central, BaseFarm, Log’In, and Unbelievable Machine. Best practice learning· Track programs and initiatives agreed with main partners key partners like Microsoft, AWS, and Huawei with respective stakeholders in OCB· Collaborate with Sales leadership to properly align on priorities· Work with APAC regional team to share best practices

 Required skills · Outstanding communications skills, both verbal and written· 10 years of experience in relevant fields, 3 years of experience with Azure, AWS, and GCP, 3 years in experience of solution building· Complete understanding of the sales process· Proficient with common office applications, including MS Outlook, MS Excel, and MS Visio· Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills (oral, written, and presentation)· Experience performing needs assessments, and making recommendations based on the discovered needs· Ability to document solution components in a timely manner while ensuring an acceptable level of detail, data integrity, and accountability· Ability and willingness to share knowledge and expertise among various organizations within the company· Ability and willingness to take the initiative to facilitate teamwork within the various organizations of the company to serve the customer· Ability to work in a team environment and demonstrate strong problem-solving skills· Capability to schedule time with flexibility to handle the varying workload, and still meet tight deadlines· Ability to multi-task and work multiple projects simultaneously

To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. We value our employees’ well-being and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at Orange Business Services, and help us make an impact on the world!

Orange Business Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to a diverse workforce and do not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, race, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, religion/belief, national origin, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

As a Package Consultant at IBM, get ready to tackle numerous mission-critical company directives. Our team takes on the challenge of designing, developing and re-engineering highly complex application components and integrating software packages using various tools. You will use a mix of consultative skills, business knowledge, and technical expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into our clients' business environment and achieve business results.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As an Associate, you’ll be a part of client-facing teams as a consultant, developer, designer, data scientist, or technical specialist to help businesses change the way they work.

Our clients' technical and business needs are constantly evolving. We’re hiring inspired, talented individuals eager to apply their knowledge and perspective to challenging work that evolves industries and our world. We prioritize ongoing learning, development of technical skills, and continuous personal growth, all grounded in a culture of coaching and apprenticeship.

Job Responsibilities

Calling on technical thinkers to help us assists clients in the selection, implementation, and production support of application packaged solutions. You’ll use in-depth consulting skills, business knowledge, and packaged solution expertise to effectively integrate packaged technology into the clients' business environment in order to achieve client expected business results. Assist clients in selection, implementation, and support of packagesGet client-facing experience and industry knowledge Leverages business knowledge to drive solutions for clients and their management

Ability to thrive in an ever changing, technology based consulting environmentAbility to translate business solutions into technical requirementsA passion for innovative ideas, coupled with the ability to understand and assimilate different points of view Openness to assist clients in the design, business architect, process development, functional implementation, and support of applications.

Job Description:

Life at Grab

At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.

Get to know the Team:

The Foundations team is a new team team responsible for cloud engineering and developer tools at Grab. We make an impact by building the automation and tooling that enable our platform and development teams to effectively and securely operate. Our team is made up of devops and infrastructure engineers. If you are looking for cloud infrastructure, devops, or devsecops opportunities, then you should join our team!

Get to know the Role:

We are looking for an engineer to automate management of cloud infrastructure and developer tooling. We believe a successful candidate has experience with one or more cloud environments, knowledge of devops concepts and practices, some scripting/coding ability and ideally some experience working in platform or CI/CD teams delivering functionality to developers, but if you believe you have what it takes then we’d love to hear from you either way. This role is required because we have a large developer community and an ever more sophisticated set of tools and automation requirements. In return, you will get an opportunity to expand your skills into a number of different areas - from systems administration through to backend coding, integration with vendor systems, cloud automation and security, SRE and more.

The Day-to-Day Activities:
You are responsible for automating common cloud operations - account/subscription creation and managementYou spend time with security ensuring that their needs are built into automated guardrails for developer resourcesYou support the developer community in their needs, always with a view to self-service and automation where possibleYou are responsible for the roll-out of new cross-cutting technologies - container clusters and service mesh, secrets management, monitoring and logging solutions and moreYou are involved in the design and implementation of new configurations for cloud resource useYou bring a knowledge of new ways of doing things and can clearly articulate technical solutions both within and outside the team
The Must-Haves:
You have experience with one or more cloud environments (AWS, Azure preferred)You are an experienced DevOps or DevSecOps practitioner, and have operated production services in cloud environmentsYou have experience with build and deploy tooling - jenkins, spinnaker, and similar You have experience with automation for infrastructure deploy/manage - terraform, cloudformation, resource manager or similarYou can easily pick up new technologies and are keen to expand your knowledgeYou have experience with micro-service architectures
Our Commitment:

We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

About Grab:

Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries.

Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.

Sales Rep - Cloud Platform 
Does being a part of helping clients go through digital transformations and moving to the cloud excite you?Do you have a passion for helping organizations on their journey to the cloud, to secure, improve, move and govern their data capital assets both on-premise and on the cloud?Does cutting through short-term ambiguity for longer-term vision come as second nature to you?
If you answered ‘Yes’ to all of these questions then this could be you! Oracle has transformed the enterprise software market with cloud computing and data driven innovation. We've launched business apps and platforms that are as easy to use and have a differentiated advantage in being able to offer an identical portfolio of infrastructure and platforms services for end-to-end data management both on-premise and on-the-cloud.
As a Sales Manager, you will demonstrate this value by helping our database install base customers move not just their database, but targeting all their workloads, both Oracle and non-Oracle to the cloud. This person will be instrumental in increasing Cloud (PaaS and IaaS) bookings. They will work closely with enterprise clients in selling them new services, as well as bringing in net new business in their territory.

Responsibilities:Define strategies and act to generate long term and short-term customer success and business results.To exceed quarterly sales targets by selling Oracle PaaS/IaaS into named accounts and/or within an assigned geographical or vertical market.Manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts.Territory identification and research, to formalize a go to market territory strategy and create qualified target account list within 30 days.Pipeline development through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. Adequate pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated territoryEngage with prospect organizations to position the Oracle solution through value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data.Manage the end-to-end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Pre Sales Consultants, Business Development Consultants, Oracle Consulting, Executives and Partners etc., and through effective utilization of selling tools such as Engineered selling process (ESPs), Customer 360, etc.Daily update of the Oracle Sales Cloud system with accurate customer and pipeline data.Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery.Continuous improvement in self-research, learning and readiness on the new product offeringsWorking closely with customer success managers ensuring the PaaS/IaaS customers are deriving value from their investments and ensure very high subscription renewal rates

Skills requiredMinimum of 8 years of relevant experience in selling enterprise software solutions or services. Ideally selling IaaS and or PaaSSuccessful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent over achievement against targets.Ability to build reciprocal relationships with different parts of the business, partners and customers and identifies synergies across LOBs and acts on opportunities to integrate business, with credibility at all levels, including Lines of Business and CxO.Solid understanding of the IT industry Cloud landscape and marketSales experience with a Cloud vendor would be beneficialCompetencies in building value proposition and positioning strong proposals.Strong interpersonal skills with proven ability to communicate across all levels and effectively adapts to varied situationsBe creative with strong problem solving skills and the ability to adapt and succeed in a fast paced and ambiguous environment.Proven ability to work well as part of an extended sales team

With the explosion of technology into every facet of the day-to-day business environment, there is a need to define an effective infrastructure to support the operating environment. This goal can be achieved by having a strategy for deploying the right technologies, and clearly defining responsibilities and accountabilities for the use and application of these technologies. We are looking for the right talent with demonstrated interest in Infrastructure technology, willing to make an impact on the continuous business growth by providing excellent Infrastructure services and solutions.As a Senior System Engineer under Infrastructure Strategy & Planning team, you will work with a team of innovators and technologists, together to create next-level solutions that improve the way our business runs. You will help to develop strategies and source solutions to better support Sea’s internal business units from the IT Infrastructure perspective. Your primary scope will be conceptualizing and transforming Infrastructure solutions and operations, with your understanding of market dynamics, technology trends and overall ecosystems.
Job DescriptionAssist in planning, developing and implementing comprehensive IT infrastructure strategies tailored to the business needs and prospects.Identify the market and technology trends that could be game-changers for IT infrastructure.Work out solution proposal for a broad set of IT infrastructure solutions and services, including Server (K8S, Database, Ceph, Hadoop, AI,etc), Storage (Enterprise storage, Object storage, File storage, HDFS storage systems), and banking related security and high availability systems (PAM, VMware, Data encryption, Backup and replication system, Application High availability cluster, Disaster Recovery Management system); present and justify to business units from the strategic level.Constantly analyze and improve the cost-effectiveness of the organization’s IT Infrastructure, and make sure it aligns with the organization's business strategy.Adopt industrial standards and best practices; drive and govern related frameworks, SOPs and templates/checklists within the Infra team to optimize the organization’s IT operations process.Strategize, develop, and maintain good relationships with various vendors and partners; build and maintain the vendor escalation channels to ensure project delivery and operational efficiency.
Job RequirementsMinimum Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Information Technology or related field.Minimum 4+ years of working experience as a Senior System engineer / Solution Architect in Cloud or IT infrastructure space.Relevant experiences and knowledge in Linux system, Server, Storage, Backup and replication, Data encryption, Private and public cloud services.Understand the requirements of different platforms and applications, proven experience of design and implement large scale IT infrastructure solution for kubernetes, database, training and inference AI platform, Hadoop systems.Experiences of planning and deploying the IT infrastructure solution with highest security requirements. Understand MSA TRM requirements and PCI/DSS compliance requirements.Experiences of working with Finance, Legal, Engineering, Project Manager, Procurement, and other cross teams and functions.Excellent skills in developing and communicating strategic plans with stakeholders from various teams (both technical and business teams), backed with comprehensive knowledge of market dynamics and technology trends in the IT Infrastructure space.Good business acumen, with fair understanding of IT Infrastructure budgets and forecasts from the commercial perspective.Strong team player, able to adapt well to a fast-paced environment.Self-motivated with a positive and mature working attitude.Proficiency in both English and Mandarin due to regional coverage.

Responsibilities & Requirement
Oracle EBS GL, AP, AR, PA Costing, Experienced Oracle Finance Functional Lead Consultant with strong experience in EBS R12 -GL, AP, AR, CM, FA, PA -Costing Primary responsibility will be to interface with Business and other key stakeholders to understand the business needs, assess Finance impacts, gather and document the business requirements, define use cases and test scenarios for UAT, facilitate testing and validations Good communication and presentation skills is mandatory At least 6+ years of relevant experience

job_desc:
Job Purpose

You are responsible for designing and developing comprehensive solutions on Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) platform, that meet business requirements. You will need to partner with key roles (e.g. project managers, business analysts, vendors etc.) to craft solutions that are aligned to architecture standards and principles, leverage common solutions and services and meet timeline and financial targets. 

The Job

 Strong experience in designing and developing content fragments, experience fragments, custom components, and page templates using the Adobe AEM platform to attain desirable business outcomes. Good understanding of AEM best practices and is able to recommend and review solutions and be hands on in project implementation.  Experience with soap and REST APIs services.  Well versed with SDLC, Agile, CI/CD methodologies. Strong knowledge of Continuous Delivery, version control, branching strategy and code management. Work with the various Business and IT stakeholders to create a detailed technical analysis analysis, outlining problems, and suggest solutions to fixes and enhancements. Gather and analyze user requirements, and prepare detailed functional, technical and integration specifications & related documents with standards and procedures. Work with delivery team to deliver system according to specification as well as track the tasks assigned to the team in meeting project schedule, quality. Troubleshooting application issues, coding bugs, and bottlenecks. Support BAU activities (security patching, deployment, etc) and ensure application performance meets the required SLA /SLO. Conducting system performance tests. Maintaining the security of all system applications. To Support/execute implementation activities and support post implementation. Provide Communication to all stakeholders to ensure deliverables are delivered. 

 Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.

About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

At the heart of every great change is a great human.

Come work at the heart of change.

Take the first step to a fulfilling tech career at Accenture. You will be exposed to the exciting work within the Public Sector, helping Singapore achieve its Smart Nation vision as you develop your career. Enhance your skills through continuous learning and development opportunities to build and strengthen your expertise in the ever-growing technology space.

You can also expect to receive professional training, mentorship and career coaching to help empower, drive, and guide you in your career aspirations and decisions.

As a software engineering associate, you will:

Be involved in the development, coding, testing, deployment, and software maintenance of the applications and products. 

Team up with others, like yourself, to develop and deliver solutions with continuous innovation and bring new ideas to our clients, improving the way operations is run.

Operate IT production services according to management protocols and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).

Together with your team, support various phases of the Software Development Lifecycle, ensuring client satisfaction and delivery excellence.

Provide operational support, ensuring production systems and devices are online and available.

Opportunity to use some of the most advanced technology around such as cloud engineering and operations, automation, RPA and SRE, intelligent call centre technologies.

Your role assignment will be based on business needs and your personal strengths.

We would love to speak with you if you have:

A Diploma / Higher Nitec / Nitec in Information Technology

A willingness to learn and an interest in technology

Good communication and interpersonal skills

Flexibility and willingness to work on different projects, if required

It would be advantageous if you are versed in the following tech stacks:

Java / J2EE / .Net / Fullstack development

DevSecOps

Data engineering / R / Python

Low code development platforms 

Documents and Information Required

job_title: Cloud Security (Financial Services), Manager, Technology Consulting
job_desc:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Cyber threats, social media, massive data storage, privacy requirements and continuity of the business as usual require heavy information security measures. As an information security consultant, you will lead the implementation of security solutions for our clients and support the clients in their desire to protect the business.

The Opportunity

This is a role where no two days are the same – so you’ll find yourself taking on plenty of new responsibilities as you go. You’ll work alongside clients and colleagues, balancing your time between developing security strategies, advising stakeholders, providing workshops and supporting business development. If you’re flexible and ready to adapt to a constantly changing environment, there’s no better place to develop your skills. Since you’ll be working directly with clients, some travel will be required

Your Key Responsibilities

As a Cloud Security Senior Consultant, you will be part of the team to assess, design, build, implement and manage security solutions for our clients and support the clients in their desire to protect the business. You will belong to an international connected team of specialists helping our clients with their most complex information security needs and contributing toward their business resilience

Skills And Attributes For Success
6 years of strong experience in design and architecture of cloud security with at least one of the following cloud environments: Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS)Understand an organization’s security policies and standards for use in cloud environmentsInterpret security and technical requirements into business requirements and communicate security risks to relevant stakeholders ranging from business leaders to engineersCollaborate with application developers and database administrators to deliver creative solutions to difficult technology challenges and business requirementsPlan and design security architectures for cloud cloud/hybrid systemsAbility to automate security controls, data, and processes to provide improved metrics and operational supportEmploy cloud-based APIs when suitable to write network/system level tools for safeguarding cloud environments 

To Qualify for the role, you must have
A recognized university degree in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, Information Technology or equivalentAt least 6 years of relevant experience. Preferably with 2 years experience in business consulting role in a leading consultancy firmPossess a CISSP certificationStrong interest in the field of information securityCreative, independent with good problem-solving skillsExcellent communicator with strong analytical, interpersonal and writing skills 

Ideally, you’ll also have
Industry related certification preferred (e.g. CISSP, CISA, CISM, SABSA, PRINCE2, TOGAF, ITIL).Cloud certification with leading public cloud vendors like Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS).Solution Level Certifications, OSCP, CREST, GIAC would be advantageous, as well as penetration testing experience 

What We Look For

Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.

What Working At EY Offers

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. We also offer you:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

Apply now.

EY | Building a better working world 

EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

job_title: Assistant Finance Manager Global Tools and Process Analysis
job_desc:
JOB TITLE: Assistant Finance Manager, Global Tools and Process Analysis

JOB LOCATION: Singapore

RELOCATION TERMS: Local terms

About Unilever International

Unilever International (UI) is an alternative but complimentary route to market, servicing white space opportunities not exploited by local operating countries. This is amongst Unilever’s fastest growing global business unit with 8 hubs (Singapore, US, UK, Korea, India, Dubai, France and the Philippines) with a diverse range of products, with expertise in utilizing 3rd party distributors and consolidators to reach consumers in over 75 countries.

UI have been operating successfully as an alternate Route to market to complement the local Unilever Operating Companies to serve these white spaces through a network of 500+ market expansion service providers and specialists via seeding initiatives. The market expansion providers or distributors in countries provide brand building and customer development services to UI under the agreed operating frameworks using the brand toolkits provided. UI have strategically evolved its portfolio from availability led growth to seeding in the last 5 years.

About The Role

UI finance has the vision to be a Future-Fit Customer-Centric finance function that is at the heart of decision making and playing a co-pilot role in adding, creating, and preserving value for UI.

This role fits right at the center of the strategic priority to future proof UI’s finance operations through digitization and process transformation. The role is based in Singapore, part of larger UI Finance Team and report to the Finance Manager responsible for Finance Excellence.

Key Responsibilities
Drive the digitization agenda of UI’s financial processes and tools, including dependency planning, risk assessment, budgeting and change management.To lead the design, build, test and deployment of UI Finance process and analytical solutions within the tech ecosystems of SAP, Bizagi, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Suit (Power BI, Power Automate), etc.Analyze and map business requirements, do gap fit analysis of processes with the objective of simplification and scalability across all hubs. Plan and facilitate the implementation of financial tools and systems, enhance the functionality and overall performance.Proactively manage changes in project scope and requirements, identify potential crises, and devise contingency plans. Identify, track, and report project performance metrics to the management.Represent the team in all applicable governance forum, engage with senior business leaders, IT partners and ensuring close working relationship. Partner with functional leads to ensure timely completion of all deliverables.Work with other teams such as Supply Chain, Customer Development, Marketing and HR and provide missing functional and operational expertise and support operations to close their knowledge gaps.Lead and develop appropriate change management plans and training documentation for embedding the processes and tools including but not limited to CRs, User guides, SOPs, etc.Key point of contact for Business Partners on all finance tools and process related matters across multiple BUs in UI.Any other ad-hoc initiatives and tasks required by the business to support UI finance vision and priorities.
Key Requirements

Experience & Personal Characteristics

Responsible for program management of UI’s Finance processes and tools, the candidate must possess both strong quantitative abilities and excellent written and oral communication skills. They are strategic, analytical thinkers who are driven by results and can innovate and develop solutions to drive financial process simplification, business analytics and in full compliance to accounting standards.

The candidate must have a university degree or equivalent level of education in finance/accounting/economics/statistics. Candidate is expected to have 5 years+ of holistic experience in different aspects of financial project management in a related industry.

The candidate has high levels of self-assurance and shows resilience and belief in own ability to achieve goals. Passion to learn and make a difference. The individual will need to be a relationship builder and able to get things done independently. Must have a high level of integrity supported by strong interpersonal skills, good maturity and ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization will be critical to the success of this role.

He/she Is Expected To Demonstrate The Following Leadership Behaviors

Lastly being part of the UI family, the candidate must be able to thrive in a fast paced and highly dynamic environment and navigate through complexities to arrive at solutions.
Strategic, Systemic Thinking & EntrepreneurialHigh Growth mind-set & Consumer/Shopper and Customer focusUL SOLs: Building talent and teams, Bias for action and change, Accountability and responsibilityStrong Communication & Influencing skills
Critical CompetenciesExperience in leading financial project implementations in an SAP environment.Must have in depth experience in SAP SD, FICO modules.Experience in SAP MDM, APO and BW is desirable.Working knowledge in database technologies (on-premise SQL/Azure cloud).Advanced knowledge in Microsoft Excel (Macros, complex formulas, power pivots, visualizations, etc.).Experience in data analytics and visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx)Working knowledge of Microsoft tools: Power Suit (Power automate, Power BI, Power Apps), Access, SharePoint, Visio.
TO APPLY

Please apply online by clicking on “Apply” below. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements. Should you not meet our immediate requirements, your profile will be registered in our talent pool system and we will match your profile to suitable future vacancies.

You will be able to access your status update through the candidate tracking link.

Thank you for your interest and application.

Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.
